
	<li id="programme_582" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>10th EDF Support to Non State Actors – Environment Component</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_582'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_582'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_582'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>European Union</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>Ministry of Finance</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Tanzania</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>Support Non State Actors at the local level to facilitate the implementation of the national policies and regulations related to natural resources management, in the field of forest, fisheries and wildlife<br />
The specific objective is to empower communities  through sustainable land use planning and participatory natural resources management activities. 6 projects financed: <br />
1) Sustainable Nou Forest Ecosystem Management Project FOOD AND AGRICULTURAL RESEARCH MANAGEMENT LBG, <br />
2) Enhancing Livelihoods through PFM in Northern Tanzania AFRICAN WILDLIFE FOUNDATION<br />
3) Sustainable Management of Chome Nature Reserve in Same District ONGAWA INGENIERIA PARA EL DESARROLLO HUMANO ASOCIACION<br />
4) Towards effective, transparent and equitable community wildlife management in Western Serengeti ZOOLOGISCHE GESELLSCHAFT FRANKFURTVON 1858 EV<br />
5) Adding Value to the Arc: Forests and Livelihoods in the South Nguru Mountains TANZANIA FOREST CONSERVATION GROUP SOCIETY<br />
6) Building effective long term fisheries co-management in five coastal districts in Tanzania, and promoting coast-wide learning on the same WORLD WIDE FUND FOR NATURE TANZANIA PROGRAMME OFFICE SOCIETY</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>Jan 2012 ---- Mar 2018</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 13,400,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd><a href="mailto:Joachim.Knoth@ec.europa.eu">Joachim Knoth</a>, EC</dd>
			<dd></dd>
		</dl>
		<div style="clear: left"></div>
	</li>

	<li id="programme_587" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Action for Access and Management Rights to Land and Natural Resources of Small Farmers in Northern Thailand</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_587'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_587'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_587'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>European Union</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>OXFAM GB</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Thailand</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>Overall Objective:  To contribute to the adoption of laws promoting equitable land distribution and natural resources management.  <br />
Specific Objective: Increased capacity of small-scale farmers and their networks in northern Thailand to organize movements for and demand their rights to land and natural resources management.<br />
The action will support the strengthening of the civil society movement for land reform to be led by the Northern Land Reform Network (NLRN) and the People’s Movement for a Just Society (P-Move).  They will engage stakeholders including the affected farmer communities, local administrative organizations (LAOs), independent public organizations, academics, the media and parliamentarians to be aware of the community rights to land and sustainable natural resources management, and call for policy implementation and relevant laws which will solve the land and natural resources access problem of small scale farmers in a comprehensive and sustainable manner.  The permanent laws will also be necessary to mitigate the risk of the change of government as experienced currently.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>Apr 2013 ---- Sep 2017</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 670,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dd></dd>
		</dl>
		<div style="clear: left"></div>
	</li>

	<li id="programme_1231" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Adapted ecosystem management to the protection against coastal erosion in a changing climate</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1231'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>

	<li id="programme_521" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Addressing Biodiversity-Social Conflict in Latin America (ABC-LA)</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_521'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_521'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_521'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>United States</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>DAI</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Colombia<br />Guatemala<br />Peru</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The overall goal of the U.S. Government in providing technical support and training under this program is to improve indigenous/minority community and local/regional governmental capacities to better address conflicts (potential and on-going) in the extractives sector that may negatively impact areas of significant biodiversity, thus leading to greater inclusion of marginalized groups.  Inclusion encompasses indigenous/minority communities active participation in the decision making processes of planned, or on-going, extractive enterprises that have the potential to negatively impact their lands, societies, livelihoods, and biodiversity.  Enhancing the ability of people, communities, and local/regional governments to address complicated issues surrounding extractive activities directly works towards USAID’s mission to (1) build local sustainability and partnerships, (2) foster innovation, and (3) strengthen USAID’s capacity to deliver results.  Extractive activities primarily refer to mining (alluvial and hard-rock) and hydrocarbon enterprises.  A key focus of this project will be strengthening organizations, including applied research centers that work on preventing and mitigating conflicts arising over extractive activities.  Developing and disseminating applicable tools for improved conflict management is a project priority.<br />
Select South and Central American countries have been identified as priorities for USAID conflict alleviation work in the LA region; this project will therefore focus primarily on these LA sub-regions.  During the first two years of project implementation, the project will focus on Guatemala, Colombia and Peru; complementing LA bilateral Mission work in the area of conflict management.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>Jan 2013 ---- Jan 2015</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 1,300,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dd><a href="https://www.land-links.org/project/addressing-biodiversity-social-conflict-in-latin-america/" target="_blank">Project weblink</a></dd>
		</dl>
		<div style="clear: left"></div>
	</li>

	<li id="programme_651" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Advancing Understanding of Forest Carbon Stock Enhancement as part of REDD+</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_651'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_651'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_651'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>Germany</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>GIZ</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Laos<br />Vietnam</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>For Vietnam and Lao PDR, which contain large areas of degraded forests the issue of forest carbon stock enhancement should be an integral part of any National REDD+ Strategy. To date, in these countries, like in most others, the focus of REDD+ efforts has been on deforestation and to a lesser extent forest degradation. Accordingly, there is a matching deficiency in guidance material and national approaches to forest carbon stock enhancement as part of the REDD+ Strategy.<br />
This project aims to advance understanding of forest carbon stock enhancement as part of any future REDD+ Agreement through exploring the technical and economic feasibility of different forest carbon stock enhancement strategies in pilot sites, across Vietnam and Lao PDR. The sites will be chosen to reflect representative forest ecosystems of the region. The results and operational guidance will feed into the National REDD+ Strategies, which will ensure their replication across the respective countries. The project also aims to better understand the economic feasibility of different options and the incentives which need to be in place to engage local communities and improve their living conditions.<br />
To bring the results to a wider audience, publications, regional and international workshops and communications platforms will be used to disseminate the lessons to the many individuals working on REDD+ and interested in advancing understanding of Forest Carbon Stock Enhancement as part of REDD+. The project has earmarked support to ensure the results can feed into the international discourse on REDD+.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>Nov 2011 ---- Feb 2015</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 620,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd><a href="mailto:programmbuero@programmbuero-klima.de">Programme Office of the International Climate Initiative</a>, IKI, +49 (0)30 338 424 - 218</dd>
			<dd><a href="http://www.international-climate-initiative.com/de/nc/projekte/weltkarte-und-projektliste/?tx_wiminnoprojektkarte_pi1[pro]=153&t" target="_blank">Project weblink</a></dd>
		</dl>
		<div style="clear: left"></div>
	</li>

			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>This programme aims at supporting African stakeholders in strengthening the role of Africa's forests and trees to adapt to climate change in ways that enhance liverlihoods, sustain buidiversity and improve the quality of the environment</dd>

	<li id="programme_862" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Agricultural Intensification and Value-Enhancing Support Project (PAIVA-B)</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_862'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_862'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_862'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>European Union<br />IFAD</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>Ministry of Agriculture and Livestock</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Burundi</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>Donor's contribution: <br />
European Union: US$ 6.00 million<br />
World Food Programme: US$ 4.66 million<br />
Other funding: US$ 2.50 million<br />
<br />
The project was designed in a post-crisis context, and it aims to contribute to the fight against poverty among the 30,000 most vulnerable households, in the six provinces north and east of the capital Bujumbura: Cibitoke, Kayanza, Karusi, Bubanza, Muramvya, Gitega and to develop organized and sustainable family farming to allow small-scale rural producers to increase their incomes. Measures will be taken to combat erosion and integrate crops and livestock, the use of pesticides and agricultural intensification.<br />
<br />
Land and natural resource governance related activities aim to strengthen the land tenure security owned or held by household; to strengthen the security of land tenure of individuals and groups who have access to State-owned marsh lands. The project aims to spread the relevant provisions of the Land Code, the Environmental Code and the law on public water resources. Women will have priority access to rehabilitated wetlands and those developed by the project.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>Jul 2009 ---- Dec 2019</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 6,000,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd><a href="mailto:h.liversage@ifad.org">Harold Liversage</a>, IFAD</dd>
			<dd><a href="http://operations.ifad.org/web/ifad/operations/country/project/tags/burundi/1469/project_overview" target="_blank">Project weblink</a></dd>
		</dl>
		<div style="clear: left"></div>
	</li>

		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_920'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_920'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>

                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>Switzerland<br />IFAD</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>Agricultural Projects Implementation Unit of the Ministry of Agriculture Water Resources and Processing Industry Community Development and Investment Agency</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Kyrgyzstan</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The aim of the project was to improve the institutional and infrastructure environment for farmers and herders, with a strong emphasis on the livestock sector. Specifically, the project intended to increase the productivity of 61,000 farmers' households nationwide, particularly targeting livestock farmers, and reduce animal diseases that have a public health impact (e.g. brucellosis).<br />
<br />
With regard to land and natural resource governance, the project facilitated the development and adoption of the Pasture Law in 2009 by raising the awareness of decision makers and advising on legislative reforms. It further supported activities related to sustainable pasture management.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>

		<h4>Agricultural Resource Management Project II (ARMP-II)</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_944'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_944'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>IFAD</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>Ministry of Agriculture</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Jordan</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The project, which builds on a first phase, aims to improve food and water security and the income levels of 22,300 rural poor households in the governorates of Karak, Tafila and Ma'an. This will be met by promoting community development and through the efficient use and improved management of soil and water resources.<br />
<br />
On land and natural resource governance, the project intends to provide support for the formation of WUAs, participatory land use planning and the use of a GIS. Activities will enhance the enabling policy, regulatory and incentive frameworks that govern natural resource use, promote integrated land use planning and mainstream sustainable land management (SLM).</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>

	<li id="programme_910" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Agricultural Sector Development Programme - Livestock: Support for Pastoral and Agro-Pastoral Development (ASDP-L)</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_910'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_910'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_910'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>IFAD</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>Ministry of Water and Livestock Development for the mainland and Ministry of Agriculture, Natural Resources, Environment and Cooperatives for Zanzibar</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Tanzania</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The programme aims to improve food security and increase incomes among 460,840 households in the areas of Manyara, Tanga, Pemba, Unguja, Dodoma and Singida. Specifically, the programme works to improve the livelihoods of the poorest agro-pastoralists and pastoralists. It strengthens the capacity of livestock communities and enhances the delivery of livestock development services to smallholders. Further it aims to improve marketing systems and infrastructure for livestock products and strengthen national and local government institutions to provide services to the livestock subsector.<br />
<br />
On land and natural resource governance, the programme stresses the importance of land-use planning particularly with respect to assuring tenure, resolution of conflicts over land and water among competing interest groups and the sustainability of the natural resource base. It adopts land-use plans which will establish clear land-use demarcation and protect and monitor water resources. The programme supports village land use planning and rangeland management through  the Collaborative Initiative on Land Issues (CALI). The goal is that on the mainland at least 72 villages will have proper land-use plans.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>Jan 2007 ---- Mar 2017</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 2,370,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd><a href="mailto:h.liversage@ifad.org">Harold Liversage</a>, IFAD</dd>
			<dd><a href="http://operations.ifad.org/web/ifad/operations/country/project/tags/tanzania/1306/project_overview" target="_blank">Project weblink</a></dd>

	<li id="programme_860" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Agricultural Services Support Programme (ASSP)</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_860'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_860'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_860'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>IFAD</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>Ministry of Agriculture</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Botswana</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The programme aims to contribute to economic diversification, reduction of rural poverty and food insecurity and improve livelihoods of approximately 20,000 farming households in the regions of Ngamiland, Chobe, North East, Central, Kgatleng, Kweneng, Southern and South East. The programme aims to achieve a viable and sustainable smallholder agricultural sector based on farming as a business, not reliant on subsidies or welfare measures, focusing on women and youth currently engaged, or potential new entrants, into smallholder agriculture.<br />
<br />
Land and natural resource governance interventions intend to strengthen participatory local land use planning in the identification, demarcation and planning of cluster farming areas. The programme aims to encourage the allocation of under-utilised land to landless women and youth while maintaining security of tenure of owners by strengthening rental agreements. Cluster Management Committees and Agricultural Management Associations will be established to strengthen group management of land.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>Feb 2012 ---- Mar 2017</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 680,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd><a href="mailto:h.liversage@ifad.org">Harold Liversage</a>, IFAD</dd>
			<dd><a href="http://www.ifad.org/operations/projects/regions/pf/des/BW.htm" target="_blank">Project weblink</a></dd>
		</dl>
		<div style="clear: left"></div>
	</li>


	<li id="programme_952" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Agricultural Value Chains Support Project (PAFA)</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_952'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_952'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_952'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>IFAD</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>Ministry of Agriculture</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Senegal</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The aim of the project is to improve incomes and livelihoods of 14,000 farmers households, specifically women and young people, in Senegal's groundnut basin. It intends to integrate farmers into profitable value chains based on local agro-ecological potential. Its most innovative feature is its focus on consolidating local value chains as instruments for fostering broad-based, self-sustaining and inclusive local development. Focusing especially on women and youth, it facilitates access to finance for harvesting, processing and packaging activities to allow better market placement.<br />
<br />
In line with the above, the project activities related to land governance support women's access to land.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>Feb 2010 ---- Mar 2016</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 250,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd><a href="mailto:h.liversage@ifad.org">Harold Liversage</a>, IFAD</dd>
			<dd><a href="http://operations.ifad.org/web/ifad/operations/country/project/tags/senegal/1414/project_overview" target="_blank">Project weblink</a></dd>
		</dl>
		<div style="clear: left"></div>
	</li>


	<li id="programme_953" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Agricultural Value Chains Support Project – Extension (PAFA-E)</h4>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>

			<dd>Senegal</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The project builds on the lessons of PAFA, which is being implemented in the Groundnut basin, and aims to improve the livelihoods of 25,000 farmers households in the regions of Kaolack, Fatick, Kaffrine and Diourbel and the Louga agro-pastoral region, through their incorporation into diversified, profitable value chains. It specifically intends to improve food security and the income of small-scale producers and to create jobs for rural inhabitants, especially young people and women.<br />
<br />
Activities related to land governance support formal land allocation and women's access to land.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Active</strong></dt>
			<dd>Jun 2014 ---- Jun 2022</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 950,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd><a href="mailto:h.liversage@ifad.org">Harold Liversage</a>, IFAD</dd>
			<dd><a href="http://operations.ifad.org/web/ifad/operations/country/project/tags/senegal/1693/project_overview" target="_blank">Project weblink</a></dd>
		</dl>
		<div style="clear: left"></div>
	</li>


	<li id="programme_1268" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Agriculture and Rural Development Support</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1268'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1268'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1268'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>United States</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>Chemonics</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Ukraine</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The Agriculture and Rural Development Support (ARDS) project will support broad-based, resilient economic growth through a more inclusive, competitive, and better governed agriculture sector that provides attractive livelihoods to rural Ukrainians. The project consists of three components: Improve enabling environment and governance of the agricultural sector; Increase investment, productivity, employment, and incomes in the agricultural sector; and Improve welfare of rural communities and marginalized producers. ARDS will create a better enabling environment for agricultural small and medium enterprises (SMEs) by strengthening the capacity of the Ministry of Agriculture to implement sector reforms, by developing a transparent legal framework for agricultural land markets, and by implementing reforms that attract irrigation system modernization investments. The Agriculture and Rural Development Support Project will improve agriculture sector competitiveness by supporting agricultural SMEs to introduce international quality and safety standards and take advantage of the trade opportunities available through the EU Deep and Comprehensive Free Trade Agreement (DCFTA). ARDS will support rural development by expanding employment and income opportunities and supporting target rural communities to develop viable economic strategies that stimulate economic growth.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>Jan 2016 ---- Jan 2020</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 20,600,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd><a href="mailto:abogdanova@usaid.gov">Anna Bogdanova</a>, USAID</dd>
			<dd><a href="https://www.land-links.org/project/agriculture-rural-development-support-ukraine/" target="_blank">Project weblink</a></dd>
		</dl>

	<li id="programme_16" class="programmedetails">

		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">

                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_16'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>United States</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>Millennium Challenge Account - Namibia</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Namibia</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The Land Access and Management Activity has two sub-activities: Community-based Rangeland and Livestock Management (CBRLM), focusing on promoting sustainable land management and grazing activities; and Communal Land Support (CLS), aimed at improving tenure security and land governance. The primary objectives of CLS are: (1) to empower residents and landholders at the village/local level to actively and effectively participate in the use and management of their land resources in Namibia's Northern Communal Areas; and (2) to improve the administration and management of communal lands.</dd>
		</dl>

	<li id="programme_1029" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Agriculture Rural Growth and Land Management Project</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1029'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1029'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1029'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>World Bank</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Madagascar</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>Support to the Regional Land Administration Offices (Cirdoma &amp; Cirtopo): This activity aims (i) to improve the current land information system, in particular the information exchange between the State land services and the municipal land offices and (ii) to establish or to improve Local Land Use Mapping (PLOFs) aiming the preparation of local development plans, including the delimitation of investment areas. The activity will focus on computerization of land services, improving the quality, accuracy and reliability of the PLOFs. The project will also provide support to the &quot;Specialized Offices&quot; (“Bureaux Spécialisés&quot; – civil servants responsible for monitoring the local land offices) to enable them to carry out their mission. This will involve training and additional equipment.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Active</strong></dt>
			<dd>Mar 2016 ---- Jun 2021</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>

			<dt></dt>

	<li id="programme_1009" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Agro-pastoral Youth Entrepreneurship Programme (PEA)</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1009'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1009'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1009'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>IFAD</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>Ministry of Agriculture and Ministry of Livestock</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Cameroon</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The programme aims to support young people in creating and managing successful agro-pastoral businesses and to promote a policy, organizational and institutional framework conducive to the creation and development of agro-pastoral businesses among young people. The programme will directly benefit 10,000 households in four regions: Centre, South, Littoral and Northwest, accounting for about 40% of the youth population living in rural areas in Cameroon. It is expected that about 4,700 agro-pastoral businesses will be created and about 350 existing businesses will be further developed. <br />
<br />
On land and natural resource governance, the programme plans to work at the local and national level to provide youth, especially young rural women, with secure access to land, and also support all beneficiaries in obtaining property titles. It will work to this end with the Ministry in charge of land affairs and with local authorities. These actions will be accompanied by consultations between landowners and local administrative institutions and by sensitization campaigns and advocacy for a more favourable framework for access to land by young people. Ideally these will result in negotiations between landowners and land users, and in the signing of a property charter recognized and respected by all stakeholders.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Active</strong></dt>
			<dd>Feb 2015 ---- Mar 2021</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 470,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd><a href="mailto:h.liversage@ifad.org">Harold Liversage</a>, IFAD</dd>
			<dd><a href="http://operations.ifad.org/web/ifad/operations/country/project/tags/cameroon/1694/project_overview" target="_blank">Project weblink</a></dd>
		</dl>
		<div style="clear: left"></div>
	</li>

	<li id="programme_928" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Agropastoral Development and Local Initiatives Promotion Programme for the South-East (PRODESUD)</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_928'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_928'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_928'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>IFAD</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>Ministry of Agriculture (MOA)</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Tunisia</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The programme intended to initiate a process of community-led sustainable development for 11,000 households in the Governorates of Tataouine and Kébili. To this end, it created instruments to promote participatory and sustainable management of pastures and water resources; to improve livestock husbandry practices; and to promote local economic initiatives.<br />
<br />
The programme recognized socio territorial units (STUs), a combination of a pastoral territory and social group, as basic unit for pasture and environmental management, and established STU development plans. It further provided assistance in the formation and empowerment of Agricultural Development Groups (GDAs), which helped to strengthen the position of the population in relation to development agents and policy makers and consequently led to efficient collective rangeland management, which reduced conflicts related to grazing arrangements. Lastly the programme supported the establishment of WUAs. All of the activities specifically targeted small-scale farmers/herders, women and youth.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>Apr 2003 ---- Jun 2010</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD - not set -</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd><a href="mailto:h.liversage@ifad.org">Harold Liversage</a>, IFAD</dd>
			<dd><a href="http://operations.ifad.org/web/ifad/operations/country/project/tags/tajikistan/1575/project_overview" target="_blank">Project weblink</a></dd>
		</dl>
		<div style="clear: left"></div>
	</li>


	<li id="programme_1006" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Agropastoral Development and Local Initiatives Promotion Programme for the South-East (PRODESUD-II)</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1006'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1006'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1006'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>IFAD</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>Ministry of Agriculture</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Tunisia</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The programme, built upon the achievements of the first phase, aims to contribute to improved living conditions and rural poverty reduction, for 13,200 households in the Tataouine region, by: Improving the management and productivity of collective and private rangeland, and of rainfed and irrigated farming systems; by diversifying income sources and expanding employment opportunities for disadvantaged groups, including young people and women; and by empowering communities to take charge of their own development.<br />
<br />
On land and natural resource governance the programme is supporting the formation and networking of farmer's organization, M&amp;E of measures to improve the management and productivity of collective and private rangeland. It further supports the communication and dissemination of knowledge regarding rangeland management activities.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Active</strong></dt>
			<dd>Mar 2014 ---- Mar 2020</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 700,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>

			<dd><a href="mailto:h.liversage@ifad.org">Harold Liversage</a>, IFAD</dd>
			<dd><a href="http://operations.ifad.org/web/ifad/operations/country/project/tags/tunisia/1622/project_overview" target="_blank">Project weblink</a></dd>

	</li>


	<li id="programme_929" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Agropastoral Value Chains Project in the Governorate of Médenine (PRODEFIL)</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_929'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_929'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_929'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>European Union<br />IFAD</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>Ministry of Agriculture</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Tunisia</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The project aims to improve the living conditions for 15,040 vulnerable rural households in the governorate of Medenine and to create new opportunities for employment by strengthening the resilience of agro-pastoral production systems. To that end, the project seeks to help public and private actors manage and develop local agro-pastoral value chains, including those for camelids and small ruminants.<br />
<br />
On land and natural resource governance, the project intends to strengthen rangeland management organizations, mostly through the capacity building of Agricultural Development Groups (GDAs). Furthermore it aims to improve natural ecosystems through the development of three participatory rangeland management plans.  It also will undertake a study to create an inventory of water points.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Active</strong></dt>
			<dd>Jun 2015 ---- Jun 2021</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 385,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd><a href="mailto:h.liversage@ifad.org">Harold Liversage</a>, IFAD</dd>
			<dd><a href="http://operations.ifad.org/web/ifad/operations/country/project/tags/tunisia/1704/project_overview" target="_blank">Project weblink</a></dd>
		</dl>
		<div style="clear: left"></div>
	</li>

			<dt>Summary:</dt>

<br />
Land and natural resource governance related interventions intended to provide support for rangeland management through surveys and mapping, demarcation and the establishment of Grazing Management Groups in 30 community associations.</dd>

	<li id="programme_1277" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Albanian-Norwegian hydrographic information project (ALNO_HIP)</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1277'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1277'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1277'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>Norway</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>Norwegian Mapping Authority</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Albania</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The project will contribute to competence and capacity building for the Albanian Hydrographic Service (AHS) and the Military Geographical Institute (MIG). Both institutes are led by the Ministry of Defense. <br />
<br />
AHS is responsible for depth mapping and navigational marking (buoys, lights, etc.). Sea measurement activities are currently underfunded, with a lack of equipment and usable boats.<br />
<br />
Activities<br />
<br />
The Norwegian Mapping Authority is assisting AHS with the acquisition of multibeam solutions for processing and management of data. The project will also provide for the education of hydrographs, as well as the procurement and installation of  two tide gauges.<br />
<br />
MGI is responsible for the production of sea and land maps, as well as the national geodetic network. MIG has a lot of good skills, but lacks modern equipment. Much of the support for this institute will be acquisition of production systems for ENCs and paper charts. Necessary upgrades to the network, server capacity and workstations will be included.  A &quot;production line&quot; will be established that includes both institutes.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>Jan 2014 ---- Dec 2018</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 1,200,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd><a href="mailto:evert.flier@kartverket.no">Evert Flier</a>, Norwegian Mapping Authority, Hydrographic service</dd>
			<dd></dd>
		</dl>
		<div style="clear: left"></div>
	</li>

	<li id="programme_1241" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Amazon Conservation Team</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1241'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1241'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1241'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>Omidyar Network</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>Amazon Conservation Team</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Colombia</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The Amazon Conservation Team (ACT) is dedicated to preserving South American rainforests by working with local communities to map and secure rights to their indigenous lands.<br />
ACT values three core components that contribute to the success and longevity of the environment around us – biodiversity, culture, and health. They deploy a successful conservation model that features various methods including ethnographic mapping, sustainable development, indigenous land protection, and land management.<br />
Omidyar Network has partnered with ACT to secure the property rights of up to 300,000 indigenous peoples in Colombia. ACT will work closely with those people and the government of Colombia to expand and constitute 31 indigenous reserves, pilot drone mapping, and help newly constituted reserves gain financial independence through improved self-governance</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>Jun 2017 ---- Jun 2019</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 1,000,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd><a href="mailto:prabley@omidyar.com">Peter Rabley</a></dd>
			<dd><a href="http://omidyar.com/investees/amazon-conservation-team" target="_blank">Project weblink</a></dd>
		</dl>
		<div style="clear: left"></div>
	</li>

		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_609'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>

        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>Germany</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>GIZ</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Congo, Republic of the</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>Working in collaboration with governmental administrative authorities and participating actors along with NGOs and local communities, the project’s mission is to assess and delineate possible protected areas in the Democratic Republic of the Congo. The project’s main focus is on strengthening the ability of these partners to initiate and implement transparently defined land use planning. The overarching objective of the project is to establish a comprehensive network of conservation areas in the DR Congo (accounting for 15% of the nation’s total area).</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>

It supports efforts to develop the future system of conservation areas and improves the living conditions of the local inhabitants. The project follows up and builds on the currently ongoing predecessor project of the BMU’s International Climate Protection Initiative ‘08_II_026_BLR_K_RSPB Torfmoore’ (peat bogs).</dd>

                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>IFAD</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>Ministry of Agriculture and Agrarian Reform (MAAR)</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Syria</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The goal of the project was to restore the production of rangelands to its optimal potential; to seek a balance in development to address most existing constraints related to social aspects and necessary infrastructure; to give attention to the security of land tenure and the social fabric; and to organize beneficiaries in cooperatives or other groupings to be effectively used as delivery channels for project activities.<br />
<br />
On land and natural resource governance, the project constituted the first attempt in Syria to apply the participatory approach for the development and management of ancestral, communally used rangeland resources, supporting communities and groups sharing well defined grazing rights.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>Dec 1998 ---- Dec 2010</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 525,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd><a href="mailto:h.liversage@ifad.org">Harold Liversage</a>, IFAD</dd>
			<dd><a href="http://operations.ifad.org/web/ifad/operations/country/project/tags//1073/project_overview" target="_blank">Project weblink</a></dd>
		</dl>

			<dd>World Bank</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Burkina Faso</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The objective is to increase economic activity in the project Area, resulting in an increase in private investment, employment generation, and agricultural production. <br />
<br />
On land, the project will:(i)Design and install an effective and socially responsible system to resolve land tenure issues, facilitate access to land, and reduce the cost of land in order to make serviced land available for development, and (ii)Develop simpler and more transparent procedures for investors to acquire land use rights and reduce the cost of land transactions</dd>
		</dl>

		<h4>Biodiversity and Watersheds Improved for Stronger Economy and Ecosystem Resilience Project</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_530'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_530'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_530'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>United States</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>Chemonics International</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Philippines</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The 5-year B+WISER Program in the Philippines aims to (1) conserve biodiversity in forest areas, (2) reduce forest degradation in seven priority sites, (3) build capacity  to conserve biodiversity, manage forests and support low emissions development, and (4) contribute to disaster risk reduction at sub-national levels.  Activities related to land tenure and property rights focus on  enhancing inclusion of indigenous peoples, upland farmers, and women in natural resources management. Illustrative activities include development of studies on costs and benefits of different land uses, co-management options for overlapping management regimes (e.g. protected areas within ancestral domains), payments for ecosystems services; forest land use planning and/or implementation;  and support for land tenure and dispute resolution initiatives.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>Jan 2013 ---- Jan 2017</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 300,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd><a href="mailto:gdy-liacco@usaid.gov">Gil Dy-Liacco</a>, USAID</dd>
			<dd><a href="https://www.usaid.gov/philippines/energy-and-environment/bwiser" target="_blank">Project weblink</a></dd>
		</dl>
		<div style="clear: left"></div>
	</li>

			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>KfW</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Vietnam</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The aim of the national component is to ensure that successful small-scale actions (i) contribute to the improvement of biodiversity protection in selected ASEAN Heritage Parks (AHP) and their peripheral areas, and (ii) to improve the living conditions of the local population. In addition, (iii) coordination mechanisms and management capacities for Vietnamese AHPs should be strengthened at national level. The aim of the regional component is to (iv) strengthen the ACB as a regional institution for the sustainable protection of biodiversity in ASEAN member states.</dd>

	<li id="programme_913" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Building Rural Entrepreneurial Capacity Programme: Trust and Opportunity (TOP)</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>

                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>IFAD</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Colombia</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The programme aims to tackle problems of inequality and poverty in rural areas, and to promote equal access to basic services, including rural financial services. Its target group is composed of approximately 50,000 rural households composed by small farmers, indigenous groups, Afro-Latino communities, rural young people, families who have been forcibly displaced and households headed by women, living in extreme poverty across 17 departments in Colombia.<br />
<br />
Land and natural resource governance issues are central to this programme supporting the improvement of environmental conditions by defining regulations signed by the community members for access to, use and protection of natural resources. These activities are specifically focusing on women and young people.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>Dec 2012 ---- Dec 2017</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 3,185,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd><a href="mailto:h.liversage@ifad.org">Harold Liversage</a>, IFAD</dd>
			<dd><a href="http://operations.ifad.org/web/ifad/operations/country/project/tags/colombia/1491/project_overview" target="_blank">Project weblink</a></dd>
		</dl>

	<li id="programme_946" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Butana Integrated Rural Development Project (BIRDP)</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_946'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_946'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_946'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>IFAD</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>Federal Ministry of Agriculture and Forestry</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Sudan</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The project aims to improve in a sustainable manner the livelihoods and resilience to drought of 40,000 poor rural households in the region of Butana. Specifically it aims to establish an effective governance framework that ensures regulated access to land and water resources.  It further aims to improve the access and bargaining position of women and men in the marketing of livestock and builds the capacity of community-based organizations to engage in environmentally sound, socially and gender equitable development initiatives.<br />
<br />
With regard to the goal of the establishment of the governance framework to ensure regulated access to land and water resources, the project intends to support the development of a herding, grazing and farming legislation to promote a regulated access regime to natural resources and provides a capacity building programme of community organization on  communal land management.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>Jul 2008 ---- Sep 2016</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 1,500,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd><a href="mailto:h.liversage@ifad.org">Harold Liversage</a>, IFAD</dd>
			<dd><a href="http://operations.ifad.org/web/ifad/operations/country/project/tags/sudan/1332/project_overview" target="_blank">Project weblink</a></dd>
		</dl>
		<div style="clear: left"></div>
	</li>


	<li id="programme_1247" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Cadasta Foundation</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1247'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1247'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1247'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>Omidyar Network</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>Cadasta Foundation</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>Founded in 2015, Cadasta Foundation uses innovative technology, services, and advocacy to advance global land and resource rights. Cadasta targets the world’s 1 billion tenure-insecure people in areas left out of government land registry systems. <br />
<br />
Through partnerships and participatory approaches that encourage the inclusion of women and other marginalized groups, Cadasta enables individuals, organizations, communities, and governments to make data-driven decisions and put communities and their needs on the map. Partners using the platform to securely store and manage land and resources data can access high-quality imagery, data layers, dashboards, and analytical tools for monitoring, advocating, and reporting.<br />
 <br />
By realizing their land rights, households and communities are improving their lives and making their communities more sustainable. Cadasta has advanced land and property rights for over 1 million vulnerable rural and urban people in 17 countries and continues to expand its tools and services to reach millions more.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Active</strong></dt>
			<dd>Dec 2014 ---- Jan 2022</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 9,680,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd><a href="mailto:ARegas@omidyar.com">Amy Regas</a>, Omidyar Network</dd>
			<dd><a href="https://cadasta.org/" target="_blank">Project weblink</a></dd>
		</dl>

                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1062'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>

			<dd>Sweden</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>Lantmäteriet</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Bosnia and Herzegovina</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The “Capacity Building for Improvement of Land Administration and Procedures in Bosnia and Herzegovina” – CILAP project, is a long term project aimed to build capacity and transfer knowledge with the overall objective to increase the effectiveness and reliability of land administration processes in Bosnia and Herzegovina. From the beginning CILAP project is planned, described and approved for six (6) years period with the goal to support geodetic authorities in BH during the whole implementation period of Real Estate Registration Project (RERP), funded by World Bank loan. <br />
<br />
The Project contributes to expected long- term impact:<br />
-By efficient land administration contribute to economic and social development, sustainable market and usage of real estates, and BiH accession to EU.<br />
The expected impact will be reached if the project main goal is fulfilled, and it is:<br />
-Confidence in Geodetic Authorities in BiH strengthened through delivering of efficient services and providing of secure and reliable information to the customers.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>

	<li id="programme_792" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Capacity Building for Responsible Minerals Trade</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_792'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_792'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_792'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>United States</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>Tetra Tech ARD</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Congo, Democratic Republic of the</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The goal of the Capacity Building for Responsible Minerals Trade (CBRMT) project is to strengthen the capacity of the Democratic Republic of Congo and regional institutions to transparently regulate a critical mass of the trade in strategic minerals in eastern DRC in order to transform the region’s mineral wealth into economic growth and development. The project supports programming in responsible mineral access, trade, and chain of custody related tin, tantalum, tungsten, (3Ts) and gold. The project is implemented in three locations with a headquarters in Kinshasa, an Eastern Congo field office in Goma supervising the conflict free minerals trade, and an office in Bujumbura, Burundi, the headquarters of the International Council on the Great Lakes (ICGLR). Partners include Pact and RESOLVE, as well as a number of Congolese organizations dedicated to the responsible minerals trade.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>Jan 2014 ---- Jan 2015</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 5,759,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd><a href="mailto:rirobinson@usaid.gov">Richard Robinson</a>, USAID</dd>
			<dd><a href="https://land-links.org/project/capacity-building-for-responsible-minerals-trade-democratic-republic-of-congo/" target="_blank">Project weblink</a></dd>
		</dl>
		<div style="clear: left"></div>
	</li>

The expected outcome is to facilitate the implementation of the Framework and Guidelines on Land Policy in Africa via enhanced capacity of the AU-ECA-AfDB LPI, RECs, African governments, civil society and other stakeholders in land policy development as well as improved land information systems, increased networking, lesson learning and knowledge sharing among practitioners in land policy and increased monitoring of progress in land policy development and implementation.</dd>
