	<li id="programme_869" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Kenya Cereal Enhancement Programme - Climate- Resilient Agricultural Livelihoods Window (KCEP-CRAL)</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_869'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_869'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_869'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>IFAD</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>State Department of the Ministry of Agriculture, Livestock and Fisheries</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Kenya</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The programme aims to contribute to the reduction of rural poverty and food insecurity of 100,000 householders in the 8 counties in the Arid and Semi-Arid Lands (ASALs): Embu, Tharaka Nithi, Kitui, Machakos, Makueni, Taita Taveta, Kwale and Kilifi, through the graduation of small ASAL farmers to commercially oriented farming for targeted value chains – maize, sorghum, millet and associated pulses. <br />
<br />
Land and natural resource governance related activities will include the development and empowerment of 8 county sustainable NRM and climate change adaptation plans through GIS in line with their County Integrated Development Plans (CIDP).  The programme will support the establishment of  Remote Sensing (RS) and Geographical Information Systems (GIS) and the training in RS/GIS of selected county agricultural staff in each county.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Active</strong></dt>
			<dd>Aug 2015 ---- Sep 2022</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 4,000,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>

		</dl>
		<div style="clear: left"></div>
	</li>


	<li id="programme_1281" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Key Registers for e-Government &amp; EU-integration</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1281'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1281'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1281'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>Norway</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>Norwegian Mapping Authority</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Serbia</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The Republic Geodetic Authority of Serbia (RGA) is the institution in Serbia entrusted with production and coordination of geographic information, and is hosting some of the key registers, such as properties, addresses and administrative units. In the future, RGA will manage their key registers in a new service oriented architecture (eliminating redundant storage of data, ensuring that registers are updated continuously directly form the data sources.)<br />
<br />
<br />
<br />
Background and Justification<br />
<br />
RGA and Kartverket have for more than 10 years cooperated in projects on improving the Serbian infrastructure of geographic information and land management, among the project results are:<br />
•Scanning and transfer of old cadastral maps to digital data<br />
•Establishment of a Digital Archive for Land Administration Data<br />
•Developing strategy and realizing cooperation between stakeholders of geographic information in Serbia<br />
•Realization of a web portal for exchange of map data and geographic information<br />
•Specifications of a new Real Estate management system (cooperation with the World Bank)<br />
•Assessment the quality of property information (Data Migration Pilot - ongoing)<br />
<br />
In the same period there has been significant developments having impact on the operation of RGA:<br />
•Serbia have launched an e-Government program and are developing a number of services for digital interaction between the public, businesses and public institutions.<br />
•The European Union has implemented a series of standards under the INSPIRE directive framework, obliging public institutions to make geographic information available on standardized formats and services.<br />
<br />
This project focuses on upgrading the key registers of RGA enabling integration with the Serbian e-Government, also enabling INSPIRE compliant services for geographic information. <br />
<br />
Project Objectives<br />
<br />
The overall objective is to support RGAs role as an online provider of property-, and geographic information to enable realization of efficient e-Government services, and European Standardisation. More specifically:<br />
1.To establish three new registers (Addresses, Administrative Units and Condominiums) as an integrated part of the RGA key registers, communicate with external data through services, and support the e-government of Serbia.<br />
2.To make geographic information available to the private and public enterprises as well as the citizens with geoportal and services that comply with the INSPIRE directive of EU.<br />
3.To integrate the new registers with services with other registers both internally and externally to RGA, thus maintaining continuous and coordinated updating and efficient work processes.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Active</strong></dt>
			<dd>Jan 2018 ---- Dec 2020</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 1,100,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd><a href="mailto:Maria.Lodin@kartverket.no">Maria Lodin</a>, Norwegian Mapping Authority</dd>
			<dd></dd>
		</dl>
		<div style="clear: left"></div>
	</li>

		<h4>Kidal Integrated Rural Development Programme (PIDRK)</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_968'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_968'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_968'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>

                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>IFAD</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>Food Security Commissariat</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Mali</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The goal of the programme was to help reduce poverty and food insecurity in the Kidal Region among 4,000 households. Its specific objectives were to increase and diversify local residents’ incomes by stabilizing returns from nomadic livestock husbandry and promoting agro-pastoral activities; and to improve their living conditions, notably those of women, by facilitating access to basic socio-economic services and infrastructure.<br />
<br />
In the context of rangeland rehabilitation the programme supported the protection of grazing paths.</dd>
		</dl>

	<li id="programme_712" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Kirehe Community-based Watershed Management Project (KWAMP)</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_712'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_712'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_712'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>IFAD</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>Ministry of Agriculture and Animal Resources</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Rwanda</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The grant aims to reduce rural poverty in Kirehe District, which is to be evidenced by a steep improvement in household food and nutrition security, asset ownership and quality of life indicators among vulnerable groups including woman-headed households, orphans and those living with HIV/AIDS. The immediate objectives of the project converge with the development of sustainable profitable small-scale commercial agriculture. The project aims to increase links between farmers, local markets and agricultural intensification program through irrigation scheme and value chain development. The project also supports the regularisation of land tenure in Kirehe district.<br />
<br />
On land and natural resource governance, the project aims to increase the capacity of government and other community institutions to ensure effective water and land use management and planning that will enable agricultural intensification through watershed planning and management, regularization of land tenure and water use management.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>Apr 2009 ---- Jun 2016</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 3,140,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd><a href="mailto:h.liversage@ifad.org">Harold Liversage</a>, IFAD</dd>
			<dd><a href="http://operations.ifad.org/web/ifad/operations/country/project/tags/rwanda/1431/project_overview" target="_blank">Project weblink</a></dd>
		</dl>

	</li>

	<li id="programme_1069" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Kosovo address signalization</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1069'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1069'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1069'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>Norway</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>The Norwegian Mapping Authority</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Kosovo</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>To support the establishment of a comprehensive public registry at the Civil Registration Authority for all addresses of private households and businesses in Kosovo, as well as street adresses for 10-15 municipalities, executed together with the Kosovo Cadastre Agency and in partnership with the EU. The overall project objective is in line with reaching EU standards.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>Jan 2011 ---- Dec 2017</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 1,724,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>

	<li id="programme_1175" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Land &amp; Corruption in Africa</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1175'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1175'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1175'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>Germany<br />United Kingdom</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>Transparency International</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Cameroon<br />Ghana<br />Kenya<br />Liberia<br />Madagascar<br />Sierra Leone<br />Uganda<br />Zambia<br />Zimbabwe</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>Launched in 2014, the Land and Corruption in Africa Programme is addressing land corruption risks by:<br />
Sharing information on how land corruption manifests and what its effects are.<br />
Ensuring that land corruption and actions to fight it are put on the agendas of governments and international bodies like the African Union.<br />
Raising the importance of combating land corruption in the global land governance debate.<br />
Educating citizens about their land rights and how to defend them.<br />
Working with governments, traditional authorities, the private sector and civil society to find solutions to combat land corruption.<br />
Ensuring intergovernmental organisations, governments and business have procedures in place to sanction offenders and bring about justice for affected citizens.<br />
Pushing for solutions to land corruption that are responsive to the needs of women, young people and other marginalised citizens</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>Jun 2015 ---- Dec 2019</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 4,390,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dd></dd>
		</dl>
		<div style="clear: left"></div>
	</li>


	<li id="programme_791" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Land Access for Women</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_791'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_791'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_791'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>United States</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>International Center for Research on Women</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Vietnam</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>To address these complexities, the Land Access for Women pilot program will combine commune-level legal rights counseling and education with advocacy efforts. Based in two provinces in Vietnam – Hung Yen in the North and Long An in the South – the program will strengthen the reach and efficacy of land rights for farmers, particularly women farmers. Research indicates that community-based paralegals are invaluable resources for poor and disadvantages persons to access legal systems to resolve property disputes.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>Jan 2014 ---- Jan 2016</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 803,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd><a href="mailto:thamner@usaid.gov">Todd Hamner</a>, USAID</dd>
			<dd><a href="https://land-links.org/project/land-access-for-women-vietnam/" target="_blank">Project weblink</a></dd>
		</dl>
		<div style="clear: left"></div>
	</li>

	<li id="programme_1082" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Land administration development and Addresses for people and businesses</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1082'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1082'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1082'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>Norway</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>Norwegian Mapping Authority</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Kosovo</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>to ensure sustainability in the IT systems at KCA. The Norwegian Mapping Authority has also focused on building skills and capacity within and outside of KCA, so that the IT solutions are sustainable when aid from Norway is phased out.<br />
<br />
The IT solution provides better security, ensures uniform registration in all municipalities, and reduces corruption by ensuring that all changes are logged with reference to the person who made the change in the registry. The IT-system works towards a central database and thus establishing a connection for municipalities and users via the Internet. The roll out of the centralized, web based IT system to all municipalities. was completed by mid 2015, A KCA geoportal is developed and in operation.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>Jan 2009 ---- Dec 2014</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 2,571,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>

			<dd><a href="mailto:helge.onsrud@kartverket.no">Helge Onsrud</a>, Norwegian Mapping Authority</dd>

	<li id="programme_175" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Land Administration Project</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_175'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_175'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_175'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>World Bank</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Vietnam</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The project objective is to increase the access to land information services through the development of an improved land administration system in selected provinces of Vietnam. This objective will be achieved through ensuring that land users, including businesses and households, have access to more efficient, reliable, and transparent services from land administration services. <br />
<br />
Project components include: (i) Modernizing the Land Registration System, to enable the development of an accurate, current, and complete information system to support land registration in the nine project provinces (activities include: completing and updating spatial data coverage, completing and updating land records, further developing and implementing a computerized land records management system to store, access and update land registration and land use information, and key policy studies in support of land administration system modernization); and (ii) Improving the Land Registration Service Delivery, by supporting the provision of access to land registration and land use data through all land registration offices, and the implementation of a program to promote awareness by the public of land information availability and participation in the processes to complete and update land records and surveying.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>Mar 2008 ---- Jun 2015</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 75,000,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd><a href="mailto:dnguyen1@worldbank.org">Dzung The Nguyen</a>, The World Bank, 84-4-3937-8246</dd>
			<dd></dd>
		</dl>
		<div style="clear: left"></div>
	</li>


	<li id="programme_145" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Land Administration Project II</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_145'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_145'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_145'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>World Bank</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Honduras</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The project aims to provide the population in the project Area with improved, decentralized land administration services, including better access to and more accurate information on property records and transactions. <br />
<br />
Project components include: (i) Policy and Institutional Strengthening, (ii) Cadastral Surveying and Land Regularization, (iii) Demarcation of Protected Areas, and (iv) Strengthening Land Rights of the Miskito indigneous people   .</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>Jun 2011 ---- Jan 2017</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>

	<li id="programme_232" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Land Administration Project II</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_232'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_232'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_232'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>World Bank</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Ghana</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The project aims to consolidate and strengthen land administration and management systems for efficient and transparent land services delivery. <br />
<br />
The project will focus on: (i) Strengthening the Policy, Legal and Regulatory Framework for Land Administration by providing a platform for continued work on the legal and regulatory framework governing land administration and land use; (ii) Decentralizing and Improving Business and Service Delivery Processes, to improve transparency and reduce the time and cost involved in delivery of services such as deed and title registration and other services provided by the land sector agencies, and (iii) Improving Maps and Spatial Data Information for Land Administration, by providing up to date maps and other spatial products and developing the infrastructure for collecting and sharing data and information to be used as inputs directly or indirectly in land administration.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>Mar 2011 ---- Mar 2018</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 50,000,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd><a href="mailto:vstanley@worldbank.org">Victoria Stanley</a>, The World Bank</dd>
			<dd><a href="http://projects.worldbank.org/P120636/land-administration-project-2?lang=en" target="_blank">Project weblink</a></dd>
		</dl>

	<li id="programme_525" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Land Administration to Nurture Development (LAND)</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_525'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_525'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_525'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>United States</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>Tetra Tech ARD</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Ethiopia</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The Land Administration to Nurture Development (LAND) project builds on previous USAID land administration and property rights projects from 2005-2013 and will operate from 2013-2018 in 6 regions of Ethiopia, on the federal level, and in collaboration with Ethiopian universities. The LAND program will continue to support the Federal and regional governments to improve land administration and land use laws based on rigorous research and to improve the efficiency of land use rights certification by government land administration institutions, primarily through trainings provided by higher education institutions. The new LAND project will also work with regional governments and pastoral communities to encourage the certification of communal land use rights to increase agricultural productivity, reduce conflict and resource degradation, and promote economic growth. Through trainings for government officials and communities, the project will also work to improve the rights of women to manage and control land and other natural resources.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>Jan 2013 ---- Jan 2018</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 11,000,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd><a href="mailto:zhaddis@usaid.gov">Zemen Haddis</a>, USAID</dd>
			<dd><a href="https://land-links.org/project/land-administration-to-nurture-development-ethiopia/" target="_blank">Project weblink</a></dd>
		</dl>
		<div style="clear: left"></div>
	</li>

		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">

                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_214'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>

                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_214'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>World Bank</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Cambodia</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The objective of this pilot project is to improve the process for identification and use of state lands transferred to poor and formerly landless or land-poor people. <br />
<br />
On land tenure, the project will provide training, incremental operating costs, goods and contracted technical services to commune councils to prepare plans for Social Land Concession (SLC) subprojects. More specifically, the project will support commune councils in identifying SLC areas, in carrying out environmental and social screening to refine the area boundaries, and in proposing the area formally for state land mapping, allocation and registration.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>May 2008 ---- Mar 2015</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>

			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>

			<dd></dd>
		</dl>

	<li id="programme_714" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Land and Natural Resources Tenure Security Learning Initiative for East and Southern Africa</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_714'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>

        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>IFAD</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>GLTN</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Eritrea<br />Ethiopia<br />Kenya<br />Lesotho<br />Madagascar<br />Mozambique<br />Malawi<br />Rwanda<br />Swaziland<br />Tanzania<br />Uganda</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The grants contribute to the development and integration of pro-poor tools and approaches for securing land and natural resource rights into development programmes in 15 selected countries within East and Southern Africa (ESA). The main objective of the grants has been to identify common issues and to enhance lesson sharing and knowledge management on land‐related tools and approaches amongst the various projects, country stakeholders and partners. The principal target group is poor women and men involved in 22 IFAD supported projects and programmes in ESA. They will benefit from tenure security measures that better enable them to invest in land and agriculture and to access credit. It also provides support for mapping, land and water rights, group rights, and inclusive business.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>Jan 2011 ---- Jan 2013</dd>

			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The Land and Rural Development Project, in collaboration with key GOC institutions, and other actors will support the development of tools, systems, and skills to enable the GOC to fulfill its mandate to resolve the land issues at the heart of the conflict. The Project will build the capacity of the institutions to administer and manage the programs to restitute land to victims of conflict and extend land titling in prioritized rural areas; and in collaboration with the public and private sectors, promote sustainable rural development to enable beneficiaries of land interventions to retain and make productive and efficient use of their land.</dd>

	<li id="programme_671" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Land Governance Assessment Frameworks (Completed)</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_671'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_671'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_671'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>World Bank</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Afghanistan<br />Burundi<br />Burkina Faso<br />Brazil<br />Cote d'Ivoire<br />Cameroon<br />Congo, Democratic Republic of the<br />Colombia<br />Ethiopia<br />Georgia<br />Ghana<br />Guinea<br />Gambia, The<br />Guatemala<br />Honduras<br />Croatia<br />Indonesia<br />India<br />Kenya<br />Kyrgyzstan<br />Moldova<br />Madagascar<br />Mali<br />Mozambique<br />Mauritania<br />Malawi<br />Nigeria<br />Peru<br />Philippines<br />Rwanda<br />Senegal<br />Sierra Leone<br />South Sudan<br />Tanzania<br />Uganda<br />Ukraine<br />Vietnam<br />South Africa<br />Zambia</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>This list of countries is where an Land Governance Assessment Framework (LGAF) has been COMPLETED.<br />
<br />
The LGAF is a diagnostic tool that is implemented at the local level in a collaborative fashion, that addresses the need for guidance to diagnose and benchmark land governance, and that is intended to help countries prioritize reforms and monitor progress over time. <br />
<br />
The instrument focuses on five key thematic areas identified as major areas for policy intervention in the land sector: the Legal and Institutional Framework ; Land Use Planning, Management, and Taxation ; Management and Public Land ; Public Provision of Land Information ; Dispute Resolution and Conflict Management. <br />
<br />
Each specific theme holds a range of indicators that are ranked to measure performance. Based on these performances, countries are able to identify and prioritize areas in need of reform.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>Jan 2012 ---- Jan 2018</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD - not set -</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd><a href="mailto:thilhorst@worldbank.org">Thea Hilhorst</a>, The World Bank, 202-473-9101</dd>
			<dd></dd>
		</dl>
		<div style="clear: left"></div>
	</li>

			<dd>Cape Verde<br />Netherlands<br />Papua New Guinea</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>In the Land Governance Multi-Stakeholder Dialogue (LG MSD), the Netherlands government, Dutch companies, Dutch financial institutions, Dutch civil society organizations and Dutch knowledge institutes work together to achieve better land governance in line with the Voluntary Guidelines on the Governance of Tenure of Land, Fisheries and Forests in the context of national food security (VGGTs). Participants in the LG MSD contribute to the development of learning trajectories/ cases as well as dialogue sessions with decision makers.   Focus is on the practical applicability and monitoring of improvements measures by the Dutch private sector, government, knowledge institutes and NGOs.</dd>

	<li id="programme_1269" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Land Governance Support Activity</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1269'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1269'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1269'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>United States</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>Tetra Tech</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Liberia</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The Land Governance Support Activity (LGSA) supports the establishment of more effective land governance systems, ready to implement comprehensive reforms to improve equitable access to land and security of tenure, so as to facilitate inclusive sustained growth and development, ensure peace and security, and provide sustainable management of the environment. LGSA is applying USAID’s collaborating, learning, and adapting (CLA) principles through the demand-driven support to the land reform agenda led by the GOL; strengthening of land governance human and institutional capacity; development of a customary land rights recognition model based on the Land Rights Policy that can be scaled up; and support of stakeholder engagement in land governance through communications and outreach and strengthening of local capacity through the provision of land sector services. In all project activities, LGSA, through partnership with government and civil society, is developing a focused and results-oriented approach through innovative yet cost-effective tools and best practices. Activities are implemented through consultative processes with USAID; the Project Advisory Committee (PAC); and government, civil society, and donor counterparts. The use of a gender-sensitive approach ensures buy-in from all stakeholders, leading to a stronger sustainability model.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>Jan 2015 ---- Jan 2020</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 15,500,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd><a href="mailto:aoneill@usaid.gov">April O'Neill</a>, USAID</dd>
			<dd><a href="https://www.land-links.org/project/land-governance-support-activity/" target="_blank">Project weblink</a></dd>

	<li id="programme_12" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Land Management for Investment Project</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_12'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_12'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_12'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>United States</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>Millennium Challenge Account - Cape Verde</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Cape Verde</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The Land Management for Investment Project is expected to improve Cape Verde’s investment climate by refining the legal, institutional and procedural environment to create conditions for increased reliability of land information, greater efficiency in land administration transactions, and strengthened protection of land rights; developing and implementing a new land information management system; and clarifying parcel rights and boundaries on targeted islands with high investment potential. The project supports the Government of Cape Verde in creating a single reliable and easily accessible source of land rights and land boundaries information, which is expected to strengthen Cape Verde’s investment climate for large and small investors and reduce land registration time and costs. The project is comprised of two activities: •Legal and Institutional Foundations Activity •Rights and Boundaries Activity</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>Nov 2012 ---- Nov 2017</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 17,300,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd><a href="mailto:TrachtenbergEB@mcc.gov">Eric Trachtenberg</a>, MCC, +1-202-521-7243</dd>
			<dd><a href="http://www.mca.cv" target="_blank">Project weblink</a></dd>
		</dl>
		<div style="clear: left"></div>
	</li>


	<li id="programme_489" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Land Management/Cadastre</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>

	<li id="programme_1267" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Land Market Development Activity</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1267'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1267'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1267'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>United States</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>Chemonics</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Tajikistan</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The Feed the Future Tajikistan Land Market Development Activity (LMDA) promotes market based principles for land tenure and aims to establish a functional agricultural land market that allows for the transferability of land use rights (such as buying, selling, or leasing land use rights), to ensure a simple and transparent land registration process, while promoting gender equality in rights and processes. The project focuses on land policy and legal development, private sector development, simplification of land registration procedures, and expansion of knowledge surrounding land use rights to rural governmental administrations and citizens, especially female landholders. USAID supports the Government of Tajikistan’s agrarian reform effort to increase agricultural productivity through the U.S. government’s Feed the Future initiative working to: strengthen land rights; expand the availability of quality agricultural inputs; crop diversification; and market development. The Feed the Future Tajikistan Land Market Development Activity supports the Feed the Future initiative, and continues USAID’s effort to support land reform and farm restructuring in Tajikistan, which began in 2004.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>Jan 2017 ---- Jan 2020</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 9,700,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd><a href="mailto:dasrorov@usaid.gov">Daler Asrorov</a>, USAID</dd>
			<dd><a href="https://www.land-links.org/project/feed-the-future-tajikistan-land-market-development-activity/" target="_blank">Project weblink</a></dd>
		</dl>
		<div style="clear: left"></div>
	</li>

		<h4>Land Productivity Project</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1055'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1055'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1055'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>United States</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>Millennium Challenge Account - Morocco</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Morocco</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>MCC’s compact with Morocco includes a $172 million Land Productivity Project. This investment comprises three activities: a) a Land Governance Activity, which will support the development and implementation of a long-term land strategy to address governance and land market constraints to investment and productivity; b) a Rural Land Activity, which aims to increase rural productivity by streamlining the process for privatizing collective lands, while making it more inclusive and more protective of the rights of land holders, including women; and c) an Industrial Land Activity to transform the current state-driven process for developing industrial land to one that optimizes public investment and attracts private sector participation in the financing, development, management and operation of industrial zones.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Active</strong></dt>
			<dd>Jul 2017 ---- Jul 2022</dd>

			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Tajikistan</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The objectives of the Tajikistan Land Reform and Farm Restructuring Project (LRFRP) are to support the continuing progress of dehkan farm restructuring and recognition of property rights leading to a market in land-use rights. The LRFRP will focus on policy and legal development, expanding awareness of land-use rights among rural government and citizen stakeholders, facilitating acquisition of land-use certificates, and building government capacity to effectively monitor and implement the land reform process.</dd>

	<li id="programme_526" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Land Reform in Afghanistan (LARA)</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_526'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_526'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_526'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>

        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>United States</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>Tetra Tech ARD</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Afghanistan</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The Land Reform in Afghanistan (LARA) project seeks to develop a robust, enduring, and Afghan-owned and managed land market framework that encourages investment and productivity growth, resolves/mitigates land-based conflict, and builds confidence in the legitimacy of the Government of the Islamic Republic of Afghanistan (GIRoA). LARA provides technical assistance and support to GIRoA institutions that address land issues, particularly the Ministry of Agriculture, Irrigation and Livestock (MAIL), the Supreme Court, and the Ministry of Urban Development Affairs (MUDA), and will create Afghan capacity to successfully design, manage, and implement needed land tenure reform for land market development.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>Jan 2011 ---- Jan 2014</dd>

	<li id="programme_157" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Land Registration &amp; Cadastre System for Sustainable Agriculture Project</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_157'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_157'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_157'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>World Bank</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Tajikistan</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The project objective is to expand farm privatization to enable more rural people to become independent farmers and take management decisions in response to market forces, by providing them secure land use rights certificates distributed in a transparent and fair manner, and providing essential complementary support services. <br />
<br />
Project components include: (i)Farm Privatization and Land Registration (i.e. privatize 300 Collective and State Farms (CSFs) in a transparent and fair manner, issue at least 75,000 secure land use certificates, and establish a uniform, parcel-based system of registration of land use rights by further supporting the central office of the State Land Committee in Dushanbe, upgrading four land offices to Regional Land Registration Offices (RLROs), establishing three new RLROs, and training staff to provide the required services). The project will finance equipment for surveying, mapping, digitization software and hardware, and training.activities include farm restructuring, reform of cadastre, surveying, titling and registration; (ii)Farm Information and Irrigation Support, to provide rural citizens with detailed information on the privatization process, including the land law, rules and regulations governing the allocations, and individual’s rights to farmland. It will train project area rural people and also support nation-wide campaigns through mass media programs, and booklet preparation and distribution, with a systematic approach to reach youth and women; and (iii)Project Management and Policy Support, by supporting the capacity development within the President’s Economic Advisor’ Office to enable Tajikistan to address national policy issues associated with scaling up the Farm Privatization Support Project  approach. The policy support will include the establishment of a small policy unit, as well as technical assistance and training, to address land administration, cotton, water management, and other policy issues related to farm privatization. The policy support will also address the special issues associated with the de facto land redistribution during the civil war.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>Apr 2005 ---- Mar 2016</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 10,000,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd><a href="mailto:vstanley@worldbank.org">Victoria Stanley</a>, The World Bank, +1 (202) 458-7811</dd>
			<dd></dd>
		</dl>
		<div style="clear: left"></div>
	</li>


	<li id="programme_156" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Land Registration and Cadastre Modernization Project</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_156'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_156'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_156'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>World Bank</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Turkey</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The project objective is to contribute to improving the quality and effectiveness of public services through spreading and making effective e-government applications. <br />
<br />
The specific objective of the proposed project is to improve the effectiveness and efficiency of the land registry and cadastre services. This will be achieved through: (i) renovating and updating cadastre maps to support digital cadastre and land registry information, (ii) making the digital land registry and cadastre information available to public and private entities, (iii) improving customer services in land registry and cadastre offices, (iv) improving human resources in the Turkish Land Registry and Cadastre Agency (TKGM), and (v) developing policies and capacity to introduce best international practices in property valuation.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Active</strong></dt>
			<dd>May 2008 ---- Dec 2020</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 278,000,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd><a href="mailto:acorsi@worldbank.org">Anna Corsi</a>, The World Bank</dd>
			<dd><a href="http://projects.worldbank.org/P106284/turkey-land-registration-cadastre-modernization-project?lang=en" target="_blank">Project weblink</a></dd>
		</dl>

	<li id="programme_451" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Land registration and information system (GLIS)</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_451'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_451'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_451'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>Netherlands</dd>

	<li id="programme_1056" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Land Tenure Security Sub-Activity</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1056'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1056'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1056'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>United States</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>Millennium Challenge Account - Niger</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Niger</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>MCC’s compact with Niger is expected to increase rural incomes by increasing the production capacity and sustainability of natural resources, and by improving select links of key agricultural product value chains. The compact will invest in integrated water management; new infrastructure, including small- and large-scale irrigation systems, market platforms and improved roads; sustainable management of natural resources; and sustainable agricultural production. These activities will benefit rural producers whose livelihoods are derived from the agriculture and livestock sectors. Central to the compact is a land tenure security component to help farmers and pastoralists have reliable, inclusive and long-term access to land improved under the compact. A transparent, participatory and fair allocation strategy of lands improved under the compact is essential to reduce the risk of land conflict. Activities to reinforce local land governance include, (i) development of local land tenure profiles, including mapping of land rights, (ii) development by local stakeholders of criteria for land allocation, (iii) formalization of the allocated land rights by obtaining the appropriate land titling instruments, iv) building capacity of local land governance agencies, v) development of local land use plans, and vi) reinforcement of mechanisms to improve management and resolution of land conflicts.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Active</strong></dt>
			<dd>Jan 2018 ---- Jan 2023</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 9,800,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd><a href="mailto:TrachtenbergEB@mcc.gov">Eric Trachtenberg</a>, MCC, 202-521-7243</dd>
			<dd><a href="http://ucpmc.ne/" target="_blank">Project weblink</a></dd>
		</dl>
		<div style="clear: left"></div>
	</li>

		<h4>Land Tenure Services Project</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_14'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_14'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_14'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>United States</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>Millennium Challenge Account - Mozambique</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Mozambique</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The objective of the Land Tenure Services Project is to establish more efficient and secure access to land by improving the policy framework, upgrading land information systems and services, helping beneficiaries meet immediate needs for registered land rights, and supporting better access to land for investment. This project comprises three mutually reinforcing activity areas:<br />
<br />
•Policy Monitoring Pillar: Improve the policy environment by addressing implementation problems with the existing land law, conducting regulatory reviews to improve upon it, and supporting training for predictable, speedy resolution of disputes;<br />
•Capacity Building Pillar: Build the institutional capacity to implement policies and to provide quality public land-related services by investing in human and information resources; and<br />
•Site-specific Pillar: Facilitate access to land by helping individuals and businesses with clear information on land rights and access and with registering their grants-of-land use.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>Sep 2008 ---- Sep 2013</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 39,500,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd><a href="mailto:TrachtenbergEB@mcc.gov">Eric Trachtenberg</a>, MCC, +1-202-521-7243</dd>
			<dd><a href="https://www.mcc.gov/where-we-work/program/mozambique-compact" target="_blank">Project weblink</a></dd>

	<li id="programme_689" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Land Use and Economic Development of the Niayes Region</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_689'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_689'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_689'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>Canada</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>Government of Senegal- Ministry of Agriculture                                                                    </dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Senegal</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The goal of the Program for Land Use and Economic Development of Niayes (PADEN) is to help to increase production and marketing of onions, garlic, potatoes, beans, tomatoes, cabbages, limes, watermelons, mangoes, papayas, and strawberries in the Niayes region. The purpose of the project is to increase the incomes of 9,000 producers (women and men), to make them true entrepreneurs, and to protect the region’s natural resources. At least half of these producers are women. The current program builds on the achievements of previous CIDA projects in the horticultural and forestry sectors, and in strengthening producers’ organizations (both women and men). However, this new activity takes the form of a program-based approach. Five government technical services and eight rural communities are the project’s key partners, with the Directorate of Horticulture of the Ministry of Agriculture as the sponsoring ministry.<br />
<br />
This program makes it possible to consolidate past activities, especially those involving the filao strip. Support activities are also needed for the whole sector that aims to strengthen producers’ organizations and certain public institutions. Finally, the program considers water research, agricultural and forest production, supply chain storage and packaging infrastructures, access to inputs and loans, and the regulatory environment (land use).</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>Jan 2009 ---- Jan 2018</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 17,740,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dd></dd>
		</dl>
		<div style="clear: left"></div>
	</li>


	<li id="programme_1270" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Land-Potential Knowledge System</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1270'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
