	<li id="programme_1305" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>N`Tene Terra - Pour une Gouvernance foncière responsable: Appui à la mise en oeuvre de la loi foncière en Guinée-Bissau</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1305'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1305'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1305'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>European Union<br />FAO</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>FAO</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Guinea-Bissau</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>L'application de la loi foncière se heurte à quatre principales difficultés internes: a) l'inexistence des organismes d'exécution prévus par la loi, b) la délimitation inadéquate des territoires, c) l'implémentation de l'impôt foncier et d) le «couplage» entre les institutions coutumières et l'État. Enfin, la fragilité et la méconnaissance du droit coutumier ainsi que la vulnérabilité structurelle des communautés locales contribuent à la faiblesse de la gouvernance foncière en Guinée Bissau où la problématique foncière est caractérisée par l'absence de gouvernance depuis l'indépendance. L'absence d?une gouvernance des terres coordonnée entre les différents acteurs (Etat, communautés locales) est un facteur d'insécurité foncière, de violation des droits fonciers (accès, sécurité, stabilité et protection), de manque de protection juridique, de fragilité des institutions.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Active</strong></dt>
			<dd>Oct 2015 ---- Aug 2021</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 3,450,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd><a href="mailto:JeanMaurice.Durand@fao.org">Jean Maurice Durand</a>, FAO</dd>
			<dd><a href="http://www.fao.org/tenure" target="_blank">Project weblink</a></dd>
		</dl>
		<div style="clear: left"></div>
	</li>


	<li id="programme_1173" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>N´Tene Terra - Pour une Gouvernance responsable: Appui à la mise en œuvre de la loi foncière en Guinée-Bissau</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1173'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1173'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1173'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>European Union</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>FAO</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Guinea-Bissau</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The objective is to contribute to the promotion of responsible governance of land tenure systems (public, private, communal, customary and informal systems). Specifically, the project supports the implementation of the land law and its regulations. The project has two cluster of activities: 1) improvement of the capacity of local land administrations (cadastre)and of customary tenure institutions 2) support for the allocation and delimitation of community lands.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Active</strong></dt>
			<dd>Oct 2016 ---- Oct 2020</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>

	<li id="programme_1292" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>ODI - Property Rights Index</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1292'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1292'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1292'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>Omidyar Network</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>Overseas Development Institute</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>Overseas Development Institute (ODI) is an independent think tank focused on international development and humanitarian issues. ODI has partnered with Land Alliance to scale up PRIndex, the first global index that measures perceptions of property rights among communities. The aim of this index is to provide a global and national-level baseline of perceptions of property rights, that is comparable, cost-effective, and widely accessible. This baseline will provide the grounding for a global conversation and movement around securing the property rights of an estimated 2 billion people who currently lack them.<br />
<br />
Omidyar Network is funding ODI to scale PRIndex to reach an initial tranche of 35 countries, with aspirations to reach 140 countries in the years to come.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>Sep 2017 ---- Mar 2019</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 3,000,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd><a href="mailto:ARegas@omidyar.com">Amy Regas</a>, Omidyar Network</dd>
			<dd><a href="https://www.odi.org/" target="_blank">Project weblink</a></dd>
		</dl>
		<div style="clear: left"></div>
	</li>

		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1095'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1095'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>IFAD</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>Scheduled Tribes and Scheduled Castes Development Department, Government of Odisha</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>India</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The goal of the programme is to improve the livelihoods and food and nutrition security for 32,090 Particularly Vulnerable Tribal Group, including 14,000 tribal households and 16,356 poor households in the regions of Eastern Ghats and Northern Plateau, through capacity building and by improving agricultural practices and community infrastructure. Support for land and natural resource governance will include measures for securing land to programme beneficiaries and providing them with land and forest titles that will be issued in the names of both husband and wife engaging the services of a specialist NGO (LANDESA). The programme will facilitate granting of community rights under the Forest Rights Act.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Active</strong></dt>
			<dd>Mar 2016 ---- Mar 2024</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>

			<dd></dd>

        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>United Kingdom<br />IFAD</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>Ministry of Tribal Affairs (MTA) and Scheduled Tribes and Scheduled Castes Development Department (ST/SCDD), Government of Orissa</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>India</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The programme aims to build the capacity of 75,000 poor households and their institutions, in the region of South-western Orissa, so that vulnerable groups, particularly women, can plan and manage their own development and negotiate improved entitlements.<br />
<br />
With regard to land and natural resource governance the key objectives of the programme include the promotion of a more efficient, equitable, self-managed and sustainable exploitation of natural resources at people's disposal and the development of non-farm enterprises for landless people. The programme supports the allocation of 0.10 acre of revenue land and titles for homestead to households and the recording of rights for all ST households up to 4 ha per household of forest land occupied by them under the Forest Rights Act.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>Jul 2003 ---- Mar 2016</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 5,665,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>

		</dl>

2. Establish capacity at SoP for efficient distribution of geographic information; <br />

In order to improve the quality of resource management in northern Namibia, the establishment of an ecological institute will be supported, which will carry out both ecological monitoring and ranger training. Overall, it is planned to support the Namibian Ministry of the Environment, by providing infrastructure, equipment and consulting services.</dd>

			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>FAO<br />United Kingdom</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>Asociación de Forestería Comunitaria de Guatemala Ut’z Che’ Escuintla</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Guatemala</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>A workshop in Guatemala, entitled “Taller Mesoamericano sobre Gestión Territorial y el uso de Herramientas Tecnológicas en Tierras Comunales Indígenas y Campesinas”, facilitated the exchange of experiences on the management of tenure rights on natural resources and territories by indigenous communities in different countries in Central America. Different practical examples of mapping of communal land rights were shared, including success stories and challenges, and training on the use of Open Tenure was provided, using the instrument as an innovative catalyser of discussion around the management of indigenous peoples’ lands rights. The participants represented territorial indigenous organizations, indigenous leaders from different communities, network of indigenous and farmers’ communities, CSOs and universities, and representatives from government institutions.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>May 2016 ---- Jul 2016</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 16,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd><a href="mailto:David.Egiashvili@fao.org">David Egiashvili</a>, FAO, +39 0657052322</dd>
			<dd><a href="http://www.fao.org/tenure/en/" target="_blank">Project weblink</a></dd>
		</dl>
		<div style="clear: left"></div>
	</li>

		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">

                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_779'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_779'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_779'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>European Union</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>Government of Ivory Coast; ASSOCIATION INTERPROFESSIONNELLE DE LA FILIERE COTON (INTER COTON)</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Cote d'Ivoire</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The overall objective of the project is to guarantee land tenure security and access to land for all citizens, in particular for smallholder producers. The specific objective of the project is to accelerate the implementation of land laws and ensure their applicability for all layers of society. The project aims particularly to mitigate conflicts by clarifying and issuing land rights to beneficiaries.. The project is structured around three components: <br />
-	Component 1 is to strengthen the capacities of the Central Administration, the Regional Directorates of Agriculture and the Districts and Sub-districts,<br />
-	Component 2 concerns the devolution of responsibilities to local administrations including (awareness of the villages, organization of land delimitation, etc.) by an inter-professional agricultural organization well established in the field, <br />
-	Component 3 seeks to strengthen inter-ministerial monitoring capacity, coordination and synergy, in particular between the Ministry of Agriculture and the Ministry of interior Affaires.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Active</strong></dt>
			<dd>Nov 2014 ---- Jun 2020</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 6,000,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>

			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Gambia, The</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The aim of the project was to increase agricultural productivity of 12,000 poor rural households nationwide by empowering them to undertake and maintain integrated watershed management activities that enhance their livelihoods and protect their natural resources. Activities gave priority to the inclusion of women in training for rice and livestock production and vegetable cultivation, and in the improvement of their access to financial services.<br />
<br />
As with all other project activities, interventions related to land and natural resource governance specifically targeted women and enhanced their access to land.</dd>

	<li id="programme_830" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Participatory Natural Resource Management and Rural Development Project in the North, Centre-North and East Regions (Neer Tamba)</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_830'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_830'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_830'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>IFAD</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>Ministry of Agriculture and Water Resources</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Burkina Faso</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The project aims to improve the living conditions and boost the incomes of 40,000 rural households in the area of Neer Tamba by assisting them in developing and strengthening their autonomy and ability to play an increasingly proactive role in creating a sustainable economic and social fabric.<br />
<br />
On land and natural resource governance, the project aims to strengthen land tenure security, especially for women, youth and rural landless. Land tenure security has been given critical importance in the project area, thus related interventions cut across all of the project's components. The strategy with regard to this is based on a general principle of securing user rights among the target populations, and a proactive approach to facilitating access to the developed plots. To this extent the project will contribute to the dissemination of legal and administrative texts among the key actors of the project. Further the project will support the establishment of  village committees dealing with land tenure issues, in target villages. The project will organize trainings of young professionals in this area to overcome the obstacle for the construction and maintenance of facilities to secure access to land.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Active</strong></dt>
			<dd>Aug 2013 ---- Sep 2021</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 9,920,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd><a href="mailto:h.liversage@ifad.org">Harold Liversage</a>, IFAD</dd>
			<dd><a href="http://operations.ifad.org/web/ifad/operations/country/project/tags/burkina_faso/1580/project_overview" target="_blank">Project weblink</a></dd>
		</dl>
		<div style="clear: left"></div>
	</li>


	<li id="programme_867" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Participatory Small-Scale Irrigation Development Programme (PASIDP)</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_867'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_867'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_867'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>IFAD</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development, the state governments of Amhara and Oromia Southern Nations, Peoples and Tigray</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Ethiopia</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The aim of the programme is to improve food security, family nutrition and by developing about 12,000 hectares in irrigation schemes for 62,000 farmers households, in four states of Ethiopia: Tigray, Amhara, SNNP and Oromia. The irrigation schemes developed will provide a model to be scaled up and replicated across the country. To ensure sustainability and the full participation of local community members, farmers will own and manage the irrigation systems through their own Water Users' Associations (WUAs). Specific targets include households headed by women, unemployed young people and people without land.<br />
<br />
On land and natural resource governance, the programme aims to issue land title certificates to small scale farmers and to ensure equitable access to land for women in these schemes. It will also support the formation and empowerment of WUAs for effective operations and maintenance and to empower women by increasing their participation in decision making bodies of WUAs and enhancing their skills in irrigated farming among other things.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>Mar 2008 ---- Sep 2015</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 275,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd><a href="mailto:h.liversage@ifad.org">Harold Liversage</a>, IFAD</dd>
			<dd><a href="http://operations.ifad.org/web/ifad/operations/country/project/tags/ethiopia/1370/project_overview" target="_blank">Project weblink</a></dd>
		</dl>
		<div style="clear: left"></div>
	</li>

	<li id="programme_1097" class="programmedetails">

		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">

		<dl class="pdetails1">

			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>Government of Ethiopia structures</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Ethiopia</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The aim of this project is to support community sub-projects in targeted pastoral and agro-pastoral sub-districts to build demand-driven social and economic infrastructure, to build community institutions, to develop a community level monitoring and learning system, and to assist pastoralist/agro-pastoralist households to improve their livelihood by promoting access to financial services and supporting improved advisory services. The project benefits approximately 2,6 million pastoralists.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">

			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>

			<dd><a href="https://operations.ifad.org/web/ifad/operations/country/project/tags/ethiopia/1522/project_overview" target="_blank">Project weblink</a></dd>
		</dl>

	<li id="programme_938" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Pastoral Community Development Project Phase II (PCDP II)</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_938'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_938'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_938'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>IFAD</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>Ministry of Federal Affairs; Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development; the National Regional State Governments of Afar, Oromia, Somali and the Southern Nations, Nationalities and Peoples Regional State; NGOs; and pastoral communities</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Ethiopia</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The project builds on successes of the first phase and aims to deliver basic social services, reduce rural poverty and enhance economic growth to 600,000 households in 57 districts in the Afar, Oromia, Somali and Southern regions. It also builds the institutional capacity of pastoral community organizations and local governments, moreover it will strengthen the resilience of pastoralists and agro-pastoralists to external shocks while improving their livelihoods.<br />
<br />
With regard to land and natural resource governance, the project supports land use planning, it promotes participatory approaches enhancing access to land by the rural poor, water and financial services and strengthening traditional institutions at the community level in pastoral areas. Women and men in pastoral and agro-pastoral communities designed and implemented Community Action Plans (CAPs) according to their own development priorities.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>Jul 2010 ---- Sep 2015</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 1,200,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd><a href="mailto:h.liversage@ifad.org">Harold Liversage</a>, IFAD</dd>
			<dd><a href="http://operations.ifad.org/web/ifad/operations/country/project/tags/ethiopia/1458/project_overview" target="_blank">Project weblink</a></dd>
		</dl>
		<div style="clear: left"></div>
	</li>


	<li id="programme_832" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Pastoral Water and Resource Management Project in Sahelian Areas (PROHYPA)</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_832'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_832'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_832'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>Switzerland<br />IFAD</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>Ministry in charge of Water</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Chad</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The project aim was to reduce vulnerability and poverty in both pastoral and agro-pastoral areas in the regions Lac, Kanem, Barl El Gazal, Batha Ouest, Batha Est, Guera, Baguirmi, Dababa and Hadjer Lamis. It aimed to improve the access of mobile livestock systems to water and pastoral resources through improved infrastructure and to strengthen the capacity of the groups and institutions involved in planning and managing these natural resources. The targeted beneficiaries were included in 32,000 households.<br />
<br />
With regard to land and natural resource governance, the project supported the mapping of existing wells and of livestock migration routes to secure the mobility of farmers and facilitated the settlement of conflicts related to livestock wandering in the fields.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>Jan 2010 ---- Mar 2015</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 1,935,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd><a href="mailto:h.liversage@ifad.org">Harold Liversage</a>, IFAD</dd>
			<dd><a href="http://operations.ifad.org/web/ifad/operations/country/project/tags/chad/1446/project_overview" target="_blank">Project weblink</a></dd>
		</dl>

			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Sierra Leone</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The TCP is facilitating the implementation of the CBF Concept at a pilot scale, drawing lessons and using it to leverage funding for future scale-up. Implementation of the CBF Concept in Sierra Leone will lead to improved security of tenure, clear incentive mechanisms, improved food security and strong community institutions which will go a long way in securing and increasing the forest resources and hence enhancing the environmental services they provide. While FAO is taking the lead in providing technical guidance and advice, the implementation of the project is the responsibility of forestry department staff at national and decentralized levels.</dd>

	<li id="programme_1232" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Piloting the use of Participatory Rangeland Management (PRM) in Tanzania and Kenya</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1232'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1232'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1232'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>European Union</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>IFAD/ILC</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Kenya<br />Tanzania</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The general objective of the project is to attain secure and better use of rangelands and expand the role of women in selected pastoral communities in Kenya and Tanzania. This will be done by developing and testing a Participatory Rangeland Management system, working under the umbrella of the ILC Rangelands Initiative. <br />
<br />
The project will be developed around three clusters of activities: <br />
- development of the Participatory Rangeland Managementsystem; <br />
- development of local and national guidelines and strategies on Participatory Rangeland Management; <br />
- capacity building of local and national governments, Civil Society Organisations (CSOs) and communities to implement the system.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Active</strong></dt>
			<dd>Dec 2017 ---- Dec 2021</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 1,850,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>

	<li id="programme_984" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Policy Coordination and Dialogue for Reducing Poverty and Inequalities in Semi-Arid North-east Brazil (Dom Helder Camara Phase II)</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_984'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_984'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_984'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>IFAD</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>Ministry of Agrarian Development (MDA), through the Secretariat of Territorial Development (SDT)</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Brazil</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The project aims to reduce rural poverty and inequality in the semi-arid north-east of Brazil through improving policy dialogue, territorial planning and coordination of public policies and programmes, directly benefitting 74,000 households. The core project area includes 129 municipalities in nine Territories of Citizenship in seven states of Brazil’s north-eastern semi-arid region. Participants in state-level projects co-funded by IFAD in the states of Bahia, Ceará, Paraíba, Piaui and Sergipe will also benefit from innovations and successful experiences tested by the project.<br />
<br />
On land and natural resource governance, the project intends to encourage and support the creation of young people' groups who want to settle as agricultural producers through the National Land Credit Programme (Programa Nacional de Crédito Fundiário, PNCF) or other land access policies. The project will support the access of the youth to the land programmes.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Active</strong></dt>
			<dd>Aug 2014 ---- Sep 2020</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 415,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd><a href="mailto:h.liversage@ifad.org">Harold Liversage</a>, IFAD</dd>
			<dd><a href="http://operations.ifad.org/web/ifad/operations/country/project/tags/brazil/1620/project_overview" target="_blank">Project weblink</a></dd>
		</dl>
		<div style="clear: left"></div>
	</li>

	<li id="programme_865" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Post-Crisis Rural Recovery and Development (PCRRDP) / Catchments and Landscapes Management Project (CLMP)</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_865'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_865'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_865'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>European Union<br />IFAD</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>Regional administrations of Debub and Gash Barka</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Eritrea</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The programme aims to improve the incomes, food security and nutrition of 171,650 households of the most disadvantaged communities in the regions of Debub and Gash Barka. It provides sustainable natural resource management to help raise agricultural productivity, and it also ensures the rehabilitation of degraded rangelands and watersheds.<br />
<br />
Land and natural resource governance interventions included in the Catchments and Landscape Management Project  (CLMP) which emerged from the PCRRDP (completed in 2013) seek to  halt land degradation in the two Zobas (districts) of Debub and zoba Gash Barka through the promotion of sustainable land management approaches, and the generation of best Sustainable Land Management (SLM) practices, while at the national level it supports the GoE in the formulation of a policy and institutional framework for upscaling successful SLM technologies and approaches.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>Jan 2007 ---- Jan 2016</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 225,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd><a href="mailto:h.liversage@ifad.org">Harold Liversage</a>, IFAD</dd>
			<dd><a href="http://operations.ifad.org/web/ifad/operations/country/project/tags/eritrea/1359/project_overview" target="_blank">Project weblink</a></dd>
		</dl>
		<div style="clear: left"></div>
	</li>


	<li id="programme_969" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Poverty Reduction Project in Aftout South and Karakoro - Phase II (PASK II)</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_969'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_969'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_969'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>IFAD</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>Ministry of Rural Development</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Mauritania</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The project aims to improve incomes and living conditions for 21,000 households in the areas of Aftout South and Karakoro. The specific objective is to help build an economic and social fabric based on sustainable natural resource management that is inclusive of poor rural households, particularly women and young people.<br />
<br />
Land and natural resource governance related interventions include land agreements to guarantee equitable access to land which will be indispensable for any irrigation scheme and the adoption of an integrated watershed management approach. Land Tenure Arrangements, both large scale or on smaller areas, help stabilize use rights, to make them more fair and accessible for the target population.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Active</strong></dt>
			<dd>Jun 2012 ---- Jun 2020</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 9,610,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd><a href="mailto:h.liversage@ifad.org">Harold Liversage</a>, IFAD</dd>
			<dd><a href="http://operations.ifad.org/web/ifad/operations/country/project/tags/mauritania/1577/project_overview" target="_blank">Project weblink</a></dd>
		</dl>
		<div style="clear: left"></div>
	</li>

	<li id="programme_1244" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>PRIndex</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1244'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1244'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1244'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>Omidyar Network</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>OVERSEAS DEVELOPMENT INSTITUTE</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>Overseas Development Institute is an independent think tank focused on international development and humanitarian issues. Overseas Development Institute (ODI) is an independent think tank focused on international development and humanitarian issues. ODI has partnered with Land Alliance to scale up PRIndex, the first global index that measures perceptions of property rights among communities. The aim of this index is to provide a global and national-level baseline of perceptions of property rights, that is comparable, cost-effective, and widely accessible. This baseline will provide the grounding for a global conversation and movement around securing the property rights of an estimated 2 billion people who currently lack them.<br />
Omidyar Network is funding ODI to scale PRIndex to reach an initial tranche of 35 countries, with aspirations to reach 140 countries in the years to come.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>Sep 2017 ---- Mar 2018</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 977,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd><a href="mailto:prabley@omidyar.com">PETER RABLEY</a></dd>
			<dd><a href="https://www.odi.org/" target="_blank">Project weblink</a></dd>
		</dl>

			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Togo</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The project aims to improve investment climate in Togo, including in a New Free Zone, and to an improved performance of targeted micro and small businesses. <br />
<br />
To achieve these outcomes, the project will support the Land Registry by providing technical assistance to help simplify and shorten the time required to register property. In particular, it will finance the following activities: Organizational diagnostic of the Direction des Affaires Domaniales et Cadastrales; Support to the implementation of the recommendations of the organizational diagnostic (technical assistance, capacity building, equipments); Review of laws and regulations governing the registration of property.</dd>

	<li id="programme_827" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Private Sector/MSME Competitiveness</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_827'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_827'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_827'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>World Bank</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Tanzania</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The project objective is to create sustainable conditions for enterprise creation and growth. <br />
<br />
land tenure activities include: (i) Convert old survey and mapping data to fit the new geodetic surveying infrastructure, and awareness-raising of the professionals about using the new system; (ii) Implement a new surveying and mapping policy in line with the modernized infrastructure; (iii) Strengthen the collection, storage and dissemination of geospatial data and improving the use of land and resource data for land use planning; (iv) Review, prepare, and process legislative pieces (e.g., a Land Acquisition and Compensation Bill, a Property Valuation Bill, and Regulations for the above), and strengthen land tribunals; (v) Support the implementation of participatory land use planning approaches in urban areas and regularization of land tenure in urban informal settlements including in Mwanza and Dar es Salaam where initial work has already been done; (vi) Review past experiences in undertaking government land inventories including in Ghana and Botswana and draw lessons and good practices that could guide preparation of guidelines for similar exercises in Tanzania; (vii) Implement regulatory changes (such as elimination of the requirement to obtain a Tax Clearance Certificate, streamlining of the procedure of notarization and execution of the sale agreement and preparation of the transfer deed, elimination of the inspection to value the property, etc.);  (viii) Reorganize workflow processes of the land registry to improve the efficiency of the process to register and transfer a property.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>Dec 2005 ---- Jul 2018</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 42,100,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd><a href="mailto:mkibirige@worldbank.org">Moses Kibirige</a>, The World Bank</dd>
			<dd><a href="http://projects.worldbank.org/P085009/private-sectormsme-competitiveness?lang=en" target="_blank">Project weblink</a></dd>
		</dl>
		<div style="clear: left"></div>
	</li>


	<li id="programme_898" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Pro-Poor Partnership for Agroforestry Development Project (3PAD)</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_898'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_898'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_898'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>IFAD</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>Provincial People’s Committee of Bac Kan Province</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Vietnam</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The project aims to achieve poverty reduction and improved livelihoods of 11,300 rural poor households in the region of Bac Kan, by building the capacity and coordinate five provincial departments and district sections to deliver project outcomes, underpinned by strong farmer organisations, stakeholders and the private sector.<br />
<br />
Land and natural resource governance activities have the aim to provide support for sustainable and equitable forest land management. The programme pays particular attention to improving women's participation in community decision making and resource allocation.  It supports the consultation with land users regarding forest land boundaries; the classification of forest land use and forest type to be allocated; the preparation of cadastral maps for the forest land allocation and the documentation required for the issuance of Forest and Land Use Rights Certificates (LURs).</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>May 2009 ---- Jun 2015</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 2,115,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd><a href="mailto:h.liversage@ifad.org">Harold Liversage</a>, IFAD</dd>
			<dd><a href="http://operations.ifad.org/web/ifad/operations/country/project/tags/viet_nam/1477/project_overview" target="_blank">Project weblink</a></dd>
		</dl>
		<div style="clear: left"></div>
	</li>

	<li id="programme_974" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Pro-poor Resource Governance under Changing Climates</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_974'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_974'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_974'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>IFAD</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>Institute for Advanced Sustainability Studies (IASS)</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Burkina Faso<br />Bangladesh<br />Bolivia<br />Brazil<br />Ecuador<br />India</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>Given the focus of the research project in understanding how climate change aggravates the vulnerability of poor rural people, the main objective of the research was to identify the fundamental social and environmental causes that put poor rural people in a vulnerable position with view to climate change and to identify their strategies of resilience.<br />
<br />
Under the umbrella of a common analytical framework, IFAD and the Institute for Advanced Sustainability Studies (IASS) collaborated with local civil society organisations involved in establishing and maintaining resource governance regimes contributing to pro-poor adaptation. Target groups explicitly included women groups and in many cases women were the main group concerned, both as subjects in the research and in the knowledge sharing activities.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>Mar 2012 ---- Sep 2013</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 400,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd><a href="mailto:h.liversage@ifad.org">Harold Liversage</a>, IFAD</dd>
			<dd></dd>
		</dl>
		<div style="clear: left"></div>
	</li>


	<li id="programme_711" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Pro-poor Value Chain Development Project in the Maputo and Limpopo Corridor (PROSUL)</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_711'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_711'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_711'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>IFAD</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>Center for the Promotion of Agriculture</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Mozambique</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>This aim of the project is to improve the climate-smart livelihoods of 20,350 smallholder farmers households in the Maputo and Limpopo corridors, comprising 19 selected districts in Gaza, Inhambane and Maputo provinces. Its expected outcome is a sustainable increase in the incomes of farmers producing irrigated vegetables, cassava and livestock including cattle, goats and sheep.<br />
<br />
With regard to land and natural resource governance, the project supports measures aimed at strengthening land rights of the project’s target groups and at improving the management of land use by Farmers Organisations (FOs) and communities. It supports FO-based analysis of land access and tenure security issues, with special attention given to identifying measures for strengthening land/natural resource rights of poor and vulnerable groups, especially women and youth.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>Oct 2012 ---- Dec 2019</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 895,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd><a href="mailto:h.liversage@ifad.org">Harold Liversage</a>, IFAD</dd>

			<dd>The goal of the project is to strengthen the organisational and individual capacities of 60,000 poor rural households, with priority to young people and women, in the State of Ceará, and increase their income through improved and increased production and enhanced access to markets and to public policies. <br />
<br />
Land and natural resource governance related activities include the participatory formulation and implementation of commercially viable business plans for agricultural and non-agricultural rural enterprises – including activities aimed at land regeneration and the adoption of good agro-ecological practices.</dd>

			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The aim of the project is to contribute to the sustainable reduction of rural poverty in the Norte Grande region of Argentina. This goal will be achieved by the beneficiary and sustainable integration of small producers into value chains, through the formation of groups and organisations. 8,000 households will benefit from this five-year project, with the creation of 900 jobs.</dd>

	<li id="programme_990" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Programme d'Appui au Foncier Rural- Côte d'Ivoire</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_990'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_990'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_990'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>European Union</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>Government of Ivory Coast</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Cote d'Ivoire</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>Le programme a pour objectif d’appuyer le Gouvernement dans ses efforts de lutte contre la pauvreté et de promotion de la paix, par un soutien direct à la mise en oeuvre de la politique foncière ivoirienne. Pour cela, il vise à (i) accroître les capacités financières et opérationnelles du Gouvernement, (ii) assurer la délimitation formelle des villages, préalable à la sécurisation foncière des droits coutumiers collectifs ou individuels, (iii) améliorer la gouvernance, notamment le cadre stratégique, institutionnel et juridique du secteur foncier et (iv) à renforcer la paix et la cohésion sociales en prévenant les risques de tensions intercommunautaires.<br />
<br />
The program’s objective is to support the Government in its fight against poverty and promotion of peace via a direct support to the implementation of the Ivorian land policy. In this regard the program aims at (i) increasing the financial and operational capacity of the Government, (ii) ensuring the formal delimitation of the villages as a prerequisite to collective and individual secure costumary rights, (iii) improving governance, including land strategic, institutional and legal framework, and (iv) strengthening peace and social cohesion by preventing the risks of inter-community tensions.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Active</strong></dt>
			<dd>Jan 2016 ---- Dec 2020</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 45,200,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd><a href="mailto:Joachim.Knoth@ec.europa.eu">Joachim Knoth</a>, EC</dd>
			<dd></dd>
		</dl>
		<div style="clear: left"></div>
	</li>

	<li id="programme_871" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Programme de préservation et de valorisation de la biodiversité (PVB)</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_871'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>

                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_871'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>Switzerland</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>Helvetas Swiss Intercooperation</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Haiti</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>Dans le Massif de la Selle - situé au sud-est d'Haïti - se trouve une des dernières forêts natives du pays. Malgré son statut  d'Air protégée, la préservation de la Forêt des pins est menacée par l'instalation autour et dans celle-ci de population à la recherche de revenus. Ainsi, le projet vise à renforcer l'Agence Nationale des Aires protégée du Ministère de l'Environnment dans ses efforts de prise en charge de la gestion participative de l'Aire protégée en incluant les acteurs locaux et en soutenant la population locale dans la création de revenus alternatifs.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>Apr 2013 ---- Mar 2017</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>

			<dd></dd>

	<li id="programme_1046" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Programme for Rural Irrigation Development (PRIDE)</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1046'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1046'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1046'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>United Kingdom<br />IFAD</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>Department of Irrigation, Ministry of Agriculture, Irrigation and Water Development</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Malawi</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The programme, which draws lessons from IRLADP, aims to enable 17,500 smallholder households to enhance their production levels to such a degree that they can provide for their household nutritional demands and deliver produce to viable markets by providing smallholder farm households a combination of 5,200 ha of irrigated land and soil- and water conservation infrastructure; promotion of good agricultural practices; and linkage to improved value chains. Land and natural resource governance interventions aim to develop resilient land and water management systems for smallholder households on both rain-fed and irrigated lands; to develop agreements on equitable access to irrigate. Water Users’ Associations will be given long-term access to the irrigated land, and will be charged with sub-letting land to their members. Measures will be introduced for ensuring equitable access for women and youth.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Active</strong></dt>
			<dd>Dec 2016 ---- Dec 2023</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 3,311,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd><a href="mailto:h.liversage@ifad.org">Harold Liversage</a>, IFAD</dd>
			<dd><a href="https://operations.ifad.org/web/ifad/operations/country/project/tags/malawi/1670/project_overview" target="_blank">Project weblink</a></dd>
		</dl>
		<div style="clear: left"></div>
	</li>


	<li id="programme_299" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Programme for Sustainable Rural Development</h4>

		<dl class="pdetails1">

			<dd>World Bank</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Vietnam</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The project will develop a national Multi-Purpose Land Information System (MPLIS) and make a National Land Database available to both the government and the public. The project is designed with an emphasis on building sustainable databases that are accurate, user-friendly, and accessible through a gradual approach to developing Land Information Systems and land databases.<br />
<br />
The project will also help the government simplify procedures and business processes for Land Registration Offices operating at sub-national levels, provide better-quality land services, and increase public awareness of land information and land services.</dd>
		</dl>

	<li id="programme_886" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Project for Market and Pasture Management Development (PMPMD)</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_886'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_886'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_886'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>IFAD</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>Ministry of Food, Agriculture and Light Industry</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Mongolia</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The purpose of the project is to reduce poverty and improve livelihoods of nomadic herder households and households living in permanent settlements, strengthening the position of the pasture users among 3,940 households in 15 Soums or Districts of 5 Aimags or Provinces, namely: Hovsgol, Bulgan, Hentii, Arhangai and Govi-Altai. It will incorporate climate change adaptation activities and improve skills for value addition to livestock products.<br />
<br />
Land and natural resource governance related interventions intend to improve access to and management of  pasture lands; to provide support for training for Soum government officials on project approach on pasture management and to build sustainable community organisations that promote sustainable pasture use and equity through inclusive approaches and socially responsible practices, through Pasture Herders' Groups.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>Aug 2011 ---- Sep 2016</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 2,385,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd><a href="mailto:h.liversage@ifad.org">Harold Liversage</a>, IFAD</dd>
			<dd><a href="http://operations.ifad.org/web/ifad/operations/country/project/tags/mongolia/1455/project_overview" target="_blank">Project weblink</a></dd>
		</dl>
		<div style="clear: left"></div>
	</li>


	<li id="programme_907" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Project for Rural Income through Exports (PRICE)</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_907'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_907'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_907'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>IFAD</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>Single Project Implementation Unit of the Ministry of Agriculture and Animal Resources</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Rwanda</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The project aims to raise the income of 128,700 smallholder farmers households by assisting them in taking advantage of concrete income opportunities in pro-poor cash crop value chains in partnership with private operators. It will achieve sustainable increased returns to farmers from key export-driven agricultural value chains, through increased volumes and quality of production, improved marketing and effective farmer organisations. The project targets households involved in the production of coffee and tea, in sericulture and horticulture. It has a national scope, and shall comprise the Southern and Western Provinces of Rwanda for tea activities.<br />
<br />
With regard to land and natural resource governance, the project aims at participating in the implementation of the National Policy aiming at providing farmers with land titles by financing the registration and titling costs of farmers’ plots in project-supported tea plantations.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>Dec 2011 ---- Dec 2018</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 255,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd><a href="mailto:h.liversage@ifad.org">Harold Liversage</a>, IFAD</dd>
			<dd><a href="http://operations.ifad.org/web/ifad/operations/country/project/tags/rwanda/1550/project_overview" target="_blank">Project weblink</a></dd>
		</dl>
		<div style="clear: left"></div>
	</li>

	<li id="programme_839" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Project for the Promotion of Local Initiative for Development (PPILDA) - ILC grant &quot;Collaborative Action on Land Issues (CALI)&quot;</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_839'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_839'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_839'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>Belgium<br />IFAD</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>Ministry of Agricultural Development</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Niger</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The goal of the project was to improve incomes, food security and living conditions for 30,000 poor rural households in Aguié Department and the neighbouring communes of Saé Saboua and Giratawa. To that end, the project has introduced cereal and food banks run by local women to help ensure availability of food year-round. It also supported the adoption of new technologies to raise the productivity of staple crops.<br />
<br />
Land and natural resource governance related interventions provided training for local youth in the use of GPS systems, and support for mapping and demarcation exercises, land market analysis and the analysis of the legislative framework.  All small properties were delimited and represented on a community map updated on a regularly basis. and maintained by the local representatives who manage the communal and individual land registers. Through the project's support 1270 land titles (2600 ha) were issued to 880 small farmers (of which 15% women), six local land commissions   and three communal committees were set up and equipped and transhumance corridors have been delineated. Workshops with the religious authorities at village level address the issue of access to land by women and the question of women's rights under Islamic law.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>May 2005 ---- Jun 2013</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 215,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd><a href="mailto:h.liversage@ifad.org">Harold Liversage</a>, IFAD</dd>
			<dd><a href="http://operations.ifad.org/web/ifad/operations/country/project/tags/niger/1221/project_overview" target="_blank">Project weblink</a></dd>
		</dl>
		<div style="clear: left"></div>
	</li>
