	<li id="programme_959" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Rural Development Project in the Mountain Zones of Al Haouz Province</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_959'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_959'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_959'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>IFAD</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>Ministry of Agriculture and Maritime Fisheries</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Morocco</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The project intended improve the incomes of poor rural women, men and young people, among 8,500 rural households of the mountain zones of the Al Haouz province, involved in the three agricultural production sub-sectors (olive, apple and lamb-meat). More specifically the project raised the productivity and quality of the three products, enhanced the value added of the targeted products through processing and packaging, and improved producers’ access to more lucrative markets. In addition, the project increased women’s participation in the planning and implementation of project activities by providing technical and organizational capacity-building which facilitated access to credit. It further rehabilitated 58 irrigation schemes covering 4,000 ha, supported soil and water conservation and land improvement activities.<br />
<br />
On land and natural resource governance, the project provided support for the formation of WUAs and for collective rangeland management, paying attention to issues related to gender inequalities.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>Jan 2002 ---- Sep 2010</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 750,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>

Collective titles were allotted to villages to strengthen land tenure security of target groups in the context of increased land values following the improvements funded by the project.</dd>

		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_9'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>

                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_9'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>

                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>United States</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>Millennium Challenge Account - Burkina Faso</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Burkina Faso</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>This project aims to increase investment in land and rural productivity through improved land tenure security and land management. Expected results include greater security of land rights and improved access to more efficient land institutions, which together contribute to economic growth and poverty reduction in rural areas.<br />
<br />
Specific activities include:<br />
<br />
- Legal and Procedural Change and Communication, to support the Government of Burkina Faso’s efforts to develop and implement improved rural land legislation and other legal and procedural frameworks;<br />
<br />
- Institutional Development and Capacity Building, to improve institutional capacity to deliver land services in rural area;<br />
<br />
- Site-Specific Land Tenure Interventions, including participatory land use management planning and clarifying and securing land rights, to ensure that the institutional development and legal and procedural change activities yield their intended benefits across targeted municipalities and agricultural development zones.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>Jul 2009 ---- Jul 2014</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 58,300,000</dd>

			<dd></dd>

	<li id="programme_949" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Ruwanmu Small-Scale Irrigation Project (RUWANMU)</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_949'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_949'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_949'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>IFAD</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>Ministry of Agriculture</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Niger</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The goal of this project is to raise the incomes and improve the food security of 65,000 poor rural households in 30 communes within the Maradi, Tahoua and Zinder regions of Niger. The project stipulates that at least 30% of direct beneficiaries should be women and 30% young people involved in production or a related area, such as handicrafts, processing or marketing. The project reinforced 1800 ha of irrigated areas, the development of irrigation systems for an additional 5000 ha of land, and the rehabilitation of 3300 ha of watershed areas.<br />
<br />
To manage the above mentioned areas in a sustainable way, the project supports land commissions involved in the process of securing land plots and the establishment of 30 WUAs. Special attention is being given to women's and youth's equitable access to the developed resources.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>Feb 2013 ---- Mar 2018</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 1,200,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd><a href="mailto:h.liversage@ifad.org">Harold Liversage</a>, IFAD</dd>
			<dd><a href="http://operations.ifad.org/web/ifad/operations/country/project/tags/niger/1646/project_overview" target="_blank">Project weblink</a></dd>
		</dl>

	<li id="programme_967" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Sahelian Areas Development Fund Programme (FODESA)</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_967'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_967'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_967'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>IFAD</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>Ministry of Rural Development and Water (MDRE)</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Mali</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The goal of the programme was to reduce the incidence of poverty among 72,000 rural households in the Sahelian zone (in the four regions of Kayes, Koulikoro, Ségou and Mopti) through better incomes and living conditions. To this end, the programme helped village communities in these areas to assess needs and identify micro-projects to which they would have contribute to in cash or in kind.<br />
<br />
With regard to land and natural resource governance, the programme has provided support for the formalisation of land transaction and schemes to negotiate and formalize collective rights to land and water. The programme created informal land property rights used to ensure access to land and water in rural areas, where property titles are virtually non-existent. To secure the long-term individual land rights of vulnerable groups, particularly women and young people, the programme supported the Land Use Plan to negotiate and formalize rights on water and land.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>Oct 1999 ---- Jul 2013</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 8,195,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd><a href="mailto:h.liversage@ifad.org">Harold Liversage</a>, IFAD</dd>
			<dd><a href="http://operations.ifad.org/web/ifad/operations/country/project/tags/mali/1089/project_overview" target="_blank">Project weblink</a></dd>
		</dl>
		<div style="clear: left"></div>
	</li>

	<li id="programme_148" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Santa Catarina Rural Competitiveness</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_148'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_148'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_148'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>World Bank</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Brazil</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The objective of the Project is to increase the competitiveness of Family Agriculture Producer Organizations while providing support for an improved framework of structural competitiveness inducing public services activities. <br />
<br />
The project will support Family Agriculture Farms (FAFs) land tenure regularization. 3,000 FAFs will obtain land titles, which will facilitate creditworthiness and compliance with environmental legislation which requires land regularization to demarcate and establish –through notarization– a “legal reserve” in 20% of their farmland (“legal reserve” is a pre-requisite to credit). It will include: (i) qualification, quantification and georeferencing of target small farms; (ii) promotion of legal assistance to obtain land titling; and (ii) assistance to demarcate and notarize legal reserves.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>Sep 2010 ---- Sep 2016</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD - not set -</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd><a href="mailto:darias@worldbank.org">Diego Arias Carballo</a>, World Bank, 55-61-3329-8603</dd>
			<dd></dd>
		</dl>
		<div style="clear: left"></div>
	</li>

	<li id="programme_853" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Scaling Up Participatory Sustainable Forest Management Program, SUFORD-SU</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_853'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_853'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_853'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>World Bank<br />Finland</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>Department of Forestry at the Ministry of Agriculture and Forestry, Lao PDR</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Laos</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>(The funding amount only reflects the support from Finland= all of Finland's funding, as, if widely understood, it could be included in the support of land tenure)<br />
<br />
The major focus – and added value - of the Lao PDR Forest Investment Plan (Lao FIP) is to promote participatory sustainable forest management (PSFM) of all types of forests, with a major emphasis on promoting the capacities of villagers and other grassroots managers. SUFORD-SU is the fourth in a series of projects promoting participatory sustainable forest management. The current project covers 13 provinces, 41 of the country’s 51 PFAs, comprising 2.3 million ha and more than 1000 villages.  <br />
<br />
The current project is also piloting an approach to forest landscape management in four provinces, and piloting village forestry in at least 30 villages in this area. It is supporting work on payment for environmental services (PES) and reducing emissions from deforestation and forest degradation (REDD+). Forest and wildlife law enforcement activities continued to be supported, as well as work on key relevant policy, legislative, and regulatory issues. The project also disseminates information on project issues, and aims to raise awareness regarding climate change and REDD+.<br />
<br />
SUFORD-SU is not only developing its own monitoring and evaluation systems for the project, but working to develop and strengthen government monitoring, reporting, evaluation, and analysis capabilities. A PFA Monitoring System (PFAMS) will be built, to complement other ongoing work such as the National Forest Information System (NFIS) under development.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>Jan 2013 ---- Jan 2017</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 11,885,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd><a href="mailto:minna.hares@formin.fi">Ms. Minna Hares</a>, Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland</dd>
			<dd><a href="http://www.suford.org/en/" target="_blank">Project weblink</a></dd>
		</dl>
		<div style="clear: left"></div>
	</li>


	<li id="programme_896" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Second Cordillera Highland Agricultural Resource Management Project (CHARMP II)</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_896'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_896'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_896'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>IFAD</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>Department of Agriculture</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Philippines</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The project aims to increase farm family income through agricultural development and enhance quality of life of 12,530 rural poor households through  the improvement of land tenure security, food security and watershed conservation in the upland area of the Cordillera Administrative region.<br />
<br />
On land and natural resource governance, the main focus of the project is to ensure the utilization on ancestral domains through indigenous practices and through the issuance of Certificate of Ancestral Domain Title and Certificate of Ancestral Land Title.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">

	<li id="programme_550" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Second Land Administration Project</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_550'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_550'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_550'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>World Bank</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Nicaragua</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The project aims to strengthen the property rights of the population in the project areas (Departments of Nueva Segovia, Jinotega, Madriz, Chinandega, Esteli and Leon) through improved regularization, titling, and registry services, and to improve Nicaragua's capacity to respond promptly and effectively to an eligible emergency. <br />
<br />
On land tenure specifically, the project will support the strengthening of key land administration agencies, land regularization, the strengthening of indigenous peoples' land rights, and the demarcation of protected areas.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Active</strong></dt>
			<dd>Mar 2013 ---- Jun 2020</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 40,000,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd><a href="mailto:epantoja@worldbank.org">Enrique Pantoja</a>, The World Bank</dd>
			<dd><a href="http://projects.worldbank.org/P121152/second-land-administration-project-support-nicaragua-land-program-prodep?lang=en" target="_blank">Project weblink</a></dd>
		</dl>
		<div style="clear: left"></div>
	</li>


	<li id="programme_849" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Second Land administration Project</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_849'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_849'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_849'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>World Bank<br />Finland</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>Palestine Land Authority, Niras</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>West Bank / Gaza</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>(The funding amount only reflects the support from Finland)<br />
<br />
The development objective of the Second Land Administration Project is to improve the design and implementation of the land registration system in the project area. There are three components to the project. The first component of the project is systematic land registration in the project area. This component will provide resources to the Palestinian Land Authority (PLA) to complete Systematic Land Registration (SLR) of at least 180,000 dunums of land in the West Bank to be implemented in two phases, and to develop their capacity to further implement SLR in the rest of the West Bank. The second component of the project is institutional strengthening of the PLA. This component will assist the PLA in implementing its mandate and, in particular, managing systematic land registration through institutional strengthening including provision of enabling technology and office modernization. The third component of the project is project management, monitoring and evaluation. This component supports the consultants for the Project Management Unit (PMU); incremental operating costs for the PMU; and project monitoring and evaluation. <br />
<br />
Remarks: Both Finland and World Bank will withdraw their support prematurely due to lack of results. The project was supposed to end in May 2017.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>May 2012 ---- Jul 2016</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 5,758,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd><a href="mailto:Jenny.Sjoberg@formin.fi">Ms. Jenny Sjöberg</a>, Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland</dd>
			<dd></dd>
		</dl>
		<div style="clear: left"></div>
	</li>

		<h4>Secure land tenure for women and vulnerable groups in Brazil</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">

			<dd>Brazil</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>This project will develop the capacity of civil society organisations and excluded women to advocate for their rights to secure tenure and property through changes in law and practice. Part of the project will involve working with the local authorities to make their process more transparent and responsive to the needs of women and vulnerable groups on tenure issues. The project will benefit 2,500 families directly and 800,000 families indirectly</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>Jan 2011 ---- Mar 2015</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 700,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dd><a href="https://devtracker.dfid.gov.uk/projects/GB-CHC-1043641-CSCF538" target="_blank">Project weblink</a></dd>
		</dl>

	<li id="programme_975" class="programmedetails">

		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">

			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>IFAD</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>ILC</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The overall goal of the grant is to enable smallholder and marginalized farmers, especially women, to achieve secure and equitable access to land. The programme’s objectives are aligned with the pillars of the 2011-2015 ILC Strategic Framework: (i) influence the formulation and implementation of national land policy for the benefit of poor rural women and men; (ii) influence global and regional land-related processes and systems in favour of pro-poor land policies and governance; and (iii) build a leading knowledge network on land governance, contributing to substantive improvements in the monitoring, sharing and uptake of land-related knowledge.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">

	<li id="programme_1079" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Securing ownership to land</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1079'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1079'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1079'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>Norway</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>Norwegian Mapping Authority</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Kyrgyzstan</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The project consists of three main components:<br />
•Establishing of six permanent reference stations for positioning services. These will complete the reference framework for the entire country and provide more accurate positioing. In addition, 30 GPS receivers will be acquired for surveying of property boundaries<br />
•Improvement of the IT-system for property registration. Today, this system is spread over several different components. This project will seek to harmonise the components and create one system.<br />
•Updating of property maps and register for 20% of the country where maps and register are still not up to date with new private properties</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>Jan 2013 ---- Dec 2015</dd>

			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>

			<dd><a href="http://kartverket.no/en/About-The-Norwegian-Mapping-Authority/Centre-for-Property-Rights-and-Development/Kyrgyzstan/" target="_blank">Project weblink</a></dd>
		</dl>

	<li id="programme_1120" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Securing tenure rights of forest dependent communities</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1120'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1120'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1120'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>FAO</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>CIFOR, FAO</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Indonesia<br />Peru<br />Uganda</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>This research is exploring the relationships between statutory and customary land tenure and how these relationships affect the tenure security of forest dependent communities, including women and other marginalized groups. Through the use of a global comparative approach and standardized methodologies, this research programme is analyzing differential success or failure of policy and institutional innovations intended to enhance secure tenure rights for forest and trees, and identify strategies that are likely to lead to desired outcomes.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>Oct 2015 ---- Sep 2018</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 2,000,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>

			<dd><a href="http://www.fao.org/tenure/en/" target="_blank">Project weblink</a></dd>
		</dl>

	<li id="programme_782" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Sécurisation des systèmes fonciers pastoraux au Niger par le renforcement de la gouvernance foncière</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_782'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_782'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_782'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>European Union</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>Government of the Republic of Niger</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Niger</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>Le projet vise à mettre en œuvre une partie des directives volontaires pour une gouvernance responsable des régimes fonciers applicables aux terres, aux pêches et aux forêts dans le contexte de la sécurité alimentaire de la FAO. Il s’inscrit aussi parfaitement dans le cadre et lignes directrices pour les politiques foncières en Afrique de la Land Policy Initiative (LPI). <br />
Ce projet est conçu pour réaliser l’inventaire national des espaces pastoraux et des ressources pastorales et renforcer les structures du Code Rural et la réalisation du schéma d’aménagement foncier dans deux régions, à savoir Dosso et Zinder qui bénéficient des appuis du Projet d’Appui au Developpement du Secteur (PADSR) sous financement de l’Union Euuropéenne dans le cadre du 10ème FED.<br />
<br />
Within the context of improving food security, the project aims to implement parts of the Voluntary Guidelines on the Responsible Governance of the Tenure of Land, Fisheries and Forests (VGGT). It is further aligned with the Framework and Guidelines on Land Policy in Africa (F&amp;G) by the Land Policy Initiative (LPI). In particular, the project aims at securing pastoral land systems in Niger. It sets out to create a national inventory of rangelands and pastoral resources. Further, the project will strengthen the structures under the Rural Code and implement land development schemes in two areas, namely the  Dosso and Zinder regions that benefit from the support of the 'Projet d’Appui au Developpement du Secteur (PADSR)' under EU funding from the 10th EDF.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>Jan 2015 ---- Nov 2018</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 3,400,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd><a href="mailto:Moussa.BOUDA-MAJA-CHARDI@eeas.europa.eu">Moussa Bouda-Maja-Chardi</a>, European External Action Service (EEAS) Niger</dd>
			<dd></dd>
		</dl>
		<div style="clear: left"></div>
	</li>


	<li id="programme_1108" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Services in the context of supporting the use of the Forests Rights Act and the VGGT among Indigenous Peoples' organizations in India</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1108'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1108'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1108'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>FAO<br />United Kingdom</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>Prayog Samaj Sevi Sanstha</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>India</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>A series of awareness-raising and capacity development material on the VGGT and the Indian Forestry Rights Act (FRA) with a specific focus on indigenous peoples (Adivasi in India) were developed. The materials include a kit targeting community leaders and local authorities, including posters, leaflets, cartoon booklets and videos. The materials were developed with the objective of giving simple information on the relevant legislation and applicable procedures to secure Adivasi’ lands and forests at local level. At the same time, the VGGT have been translated and disseminated in four indigenous languages used in India. in January 2017, a meeting was organized at the Nalsar University of Law to discuss the establishment of a network of lawyers, lawmakers, judges, universities, and organizations working in supporting the rights of Adivasi and other marginalized communities. The network, which is currently being established, will support the recognition of tenure rights of indigenous peoples in India in collaboration with NALSAR University, PRAYOG and other organizations working with Adivasi and indigenous peoples.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>Dec 2016 ---- Feb 2017</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 25,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd><a href="mailto:David.Egiashvili@fao.org">David Egiashvili</a>, FAO, +39 0657052322</dd>
			<dd><a href="http://www.fao.org/tenure/en/" target="_blank">Project weblink</a></dd>
		</dl>
		<div style="clear: left"></div>
	</li>


	<li id="programme_1256" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Sir Ratan Tata Trust</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1256'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1256'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1256'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>Omidyar Network</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>Sir Ratan Tata Trust</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>India</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>Omidyar Network partnered with Tata Trusts to map the Odisha slum’s informal settlements and to identify 100,0000 households eligible to benefit from the recent Odisha Land Rights to Slum Dwellers Act, which aims to identify, map, and issue titles for parcels of land currently occupied by slum households. The urban slum titling project utilizes specialized resources in drone technology, geospatial mapping and machine learning.<br />
Odisha is the second largest slum in India and the partnership provided households with property titles, otherwise known as “patta”. With patta, individuals can have access to secure benefits like education and bank accounts. <br />
Learn more about why we partnered with Tata Trusts on this project</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>Apr 2018 ---- Apr 2019</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 1,700,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dd></dd>
		</dl>

	</li>


	<li id="programme_1192" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Small and medium irrigation perimeters (PMH III)</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">

	<li id="programme_1005" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Small Irrigation and Market Access Development Project in the Nippes and Goavienne Region (PPI-3)</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1005'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1005'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1005'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>IFAD</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>Ministry of Agriculture, Natural Resources and Rural Development</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Haiti</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The project aims to support local organizations working on irrigation schemes and watershed management in the Nippes and Goavienne region, benefiting 28,000 poor rural households. The specific objectives include: (i) Increasing agricultural production sustainably through efficient water management and the consolidation of both collective and individual irrigated agriculture; (ii) Improving the value of irrigated agriculture production, and increasing farmers' access to markets and financial services; (iii) Strengthening the planning, organizational and management capacities of grassroots organizations to increase their access to markets and financial services.<br />
<br />
Regarding land and natural resource governance the project, similar to the Small-scale Irrigation Development Project (PPI-2) completed in 2015, aims at ensuring tenure security for the beneficiaries of rehabilitated or newly constructed irrigation schemes. The activities included the mapping of the irrigated area, the setting-up of a database listing all identified irrigation scheme users and when possible the issuance of a land title for the parcels used. Further capacity-building activities for WUAs are being undertaken and user fees for the irrigation schemes collected.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>Oct 2012 ---- Dec 2017</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 590,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd><a href="mailto:h.liversage@ifad.org">Harold Liversage</a>, IFAD</dd>
			<dd><a href="http://operations.ifad.org/web/ifad/operations/country/project/tags/haiti/1532/project_overview" target="_blank">Project weblink</a></dd>
		</dl>
		<div style="clear: left"></div>
	</li>

	<li id="programme_941" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Smallholder Agricultural Development Project (SADP)</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_941'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_941'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_941'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>World Bank<br />IFAD</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>Ministry of Agriculture and Food Security</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Lesotho</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The project aims to support 15,000 smallholder farmers' households to exploit opportunities to increase their productivity and diversify into market-oriented agriculture. The project area covers four of Lesotho’s 10 districts: Berea, Leribe, Butha Buthe and Mafeteng.  Emphasis is placed on identifying commercially viable activities that can be replicated and successfully scaled up.<br />
<br />
Land and natural resource governance activities include the preparation and implementation of three year Agricultural Investment Plans and the formulation of land use and settlement plans.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>Dec 2011 ---- Mar 2018</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 200,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>

	<li id="programme_978" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Smallholder Commercialization Programme - under the Global Agricultural Food Security Programme (SCP-GAFSP)</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_978'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_978'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_978'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>

                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>IFAD</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>Ministry of Agriculture, Forestry and Food Security (Implementation support agency: FAO)</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Sierra Leone</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The programme aims to empower the rural poor to increase their food security and incomes on a sustainable basis with a view to achieving long-term economic development and poverty reduction. Specifically it aims to reduce the gap between national rice production and demand (70,000 metric tons) and to increase farm incomes by 10% for the 100,000 direct beneficiaries.<br />
<br />
On land and natural resource governance, the programme, through the Land and Water Development Division (LWDD), carries out topographic, soil, hydrological, social and economic surveys to plan the rehabilitation of the Inland Valley Swamp (IVS). With the prospect of the rehabilitation of the swamp, LWDD is training youth contractors and communities in rehabilitation works and water management.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>Jul 2011 ---- Sep 2016</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 850,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>

	<li id="programme_939" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Smallholder Dairy Commercialization Programme (SDCP)</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_939'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_939'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_939'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>IFAD</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>Ministry of Livestock and Fisheries Development</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Kenya</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The programme goal is to foster market-driven development of Kenya's informal dairy industry, working with poor smallholder dairy producers and traders to strengthen their capacity to respond to market opportunities. It builds understanding of the market and technical knowledge of production processes, and improves organizational and enterprise skills. Dairy production improves household nutrition and provides extra income. The programme will benefit 24,000 households in the areas of Bungoma, Trans Nzoia, Kakamega, Uasin Gishu, Nandi, Nakuru, Nyamira, Kisii and Bomet.<br />
<br />
On land and natural resource governance, the programme provides support  for community mobilization and capacity building for a participatory analysis and mapping  with dairy groups and land access for the groups and their communities. These activities also include documenting and mapping of existing land ownership and using practices and records and sharing experiences with others.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>Jul 2006 ---- Sep 2015</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 200,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd><a href="mailto:h.liversage@ifad.org">Harold Liversage</a>, IFAD</dd>
			<dd><a href="http://operations.ifad.org/web/ifad/operations/country/project/tags/kenya/1305/project_overview" target="_blank">Project weblink</a></dd>
		</dl>

	<li id="programme_1047" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Smallholder Market-led Project (SMLP)</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1047'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>IFAD</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>Ministry of Agriculture</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Swaziland</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The purpose of the project is to enhance food and nutrition security and incomes among smallholder producer families of 10,355 households through diversified agricultural production and market linkages in the rain-fed Middleveld and Lowveld areas of the Lubombo and Shiselweni regions. On land and natural resource governance, the Chief's Letter of Consent will be used as means to transform communal grazing land in land for commercial agriculture and as a means to give specific groups of smallholders the usufruct of such land in return for guarantees on sustainable use. In parallel to the CDC-led appraisals, the Project will prepare GIS base maps recording land use and land resources from available remote sensing information and other existing secondary sources.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Active</strong></dt>
			<dd>Feb 2016 ---- Mar 2022</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 2,300,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>

			<dd><a href="https://operations.ifad.org/web/ifad/operations/country/project/tags/swaziland/1665/project_overview" target="_blank">Project weblink</a></dd>

	<li id="programme_1008" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Smallholder Plantations Entrepreneurship Development Programme (SPEnDP)</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1008'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1008'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1008'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>IFAD</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>Ministry of Plantation Industries</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Sri Lanka</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The programme aims to improve the livelihoods of 8,700 marginalized smallholder tea producers households of Hadabima and Mahaweli resettlements in the intermediate zone of Moneragala willing to take up rubber. It intends to improve the productivity of the old tea plantation lands and new rubber-based cultivations by improving access rights to the land under out-grower schemes, and by supporting diversification and development of out-grower systems for tea and rubber. <br />
<br />
Land and natural resource governance related activities aim to ensure land tenure security and land access to the targeted people, which 35% will be women, by applying sustainable land use systems. It intends to provide support for mapping and surveying of smallholder lots to verify official ownership and to support community mobilization and capacity building. The programme implemented the initiative of MPI and MC S-PMU, Land Reform Commission to reduce the land utilization fee on a 3-tier formula.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>Nov 2007 ---- Dec 2017</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 200,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd><a href="mailto:h.liversage@ifad.org">Harold Liversage</a>, IFAD</dd>
			<dd><a href="http://operations.ifad.org/web/ifad/operations/country/project/tags/sri_lanka/1316/project_overview" target="_blank">Project weblink</a></dd>
		</dl>
		<div style="clear: left"></div>
	</li>


	<li id="programme_911" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Smallholder Productivity Promotion Programme (S3P)</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_911'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_911'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_911'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>IFAD<br />Finland</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>Ministry of Agriculture and Cooperatives</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Zambia</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The goal of the programme is to improve income levels and food and nutrition security of 60,000 poor rural households, in three provinces of Zambia: Kasama, Mansa and Lusaka, who depend on agriculture and/or agricultural related activities. The programme will complement the Smallholder Agribusiness Promotion Programme (SAPP) and will support the efforts of the Ministry of Agriculture and Cooperatives (MACO) by enhancing on-farm productivity of smallholder farmers thus enabling them to respond to emerging market opportunities.<br />
<br />
Land and natural resource governance related activities aim to strengthen the participatory community-level land use planning, management processes land tenure security through the provision of technical support for training and the development of guidelines, these activities will be gender sensitive and include boundary demarcation of female-headed households and women’s fields according to households as appropriate.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>Dec 2011 ---- Dec 2018</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 355,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd><a href="mailto:h.liversage@ifad.org">Harold Liversage</a>, IFAD</dd>
			<dd><a href="http://operations.ifad.org/web/ifad/operations/country/project/tags/zambia/1567/project_overview" target="_blank">Project weblink</a></dd>
		</dl>
		<div style="clear: left"></div>
	</li>


	<li id="programme_1045" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Smallholder Tea and Rubber Revitalization Project (STaRR)</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1045'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1045'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1045'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>IFAD</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>Ministry of Plantation Industry</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Sri Lanka</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The project aims to increase resilience and strengthen the natural resource and economic asset base for poor rural women and men by helping smallholder tea producers increase their yields through replantation and therefore providing a source of income through new rubber plantations. The programme works with 35,000 existing tea smallholders and 15, 000 poor households involved in rubber production and processing. On land and natural resource governance, the project aims to improve tenure security and land access as the benefits will increase the role of women in the plantation sector, increase capacity building and training opportunities and increase access to on and off-farm activities. The project activities include participatory mapping and analysis.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Active</strong></dt>
			<dd>Jan 2015 ---- Jan 2021</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 900,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd><a href="mailto:h.liversage@ifad.org">Harold Liversage</a>, IFAD</dd>
			<dd><a href="https://operations.ifad.org/web/ifad/operations/country/project/tags/sri_lanka/1731/project_overview" target="_blank">Project weblink</a></dd>
		</dl>

	<li id="programme_965" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Smallholder Tree Crop Revitalization Support Project (STCRSP)</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_965'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_965'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_965'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>IFAD</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>Ministry of Agriculture</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Liberia</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The project includes poor smallholders who cultivate less than two ha of land and rely on subsistence farming, as well as households headed by women, young people, war-wounded and disabled people among 15,000 households in the Lofa county. It aims to increase the quantity sold and the price received by poor farmers for cocoa and coffee by rehabilitating plantations, improving access to markets and by strengthening the Ministry of Agriculture and/or private extension services as well as Farmers-based Organisations. The rehabilitation of 315 km of farm-to-market roads and 15,000 ha of cocoa/coffee plantations, using a value chain model, aim at generating employment opportunities, mainly benefitting youth and women.<br />
<br />
The project aims at improving land tenure security, as the two partners for tree crop rehabilitation (Bio United and cooperatives) will be in charge of formalizing the farmers’ ownership over their plots. A memorandum of understanding with the project coordination unit (PCU) will be approved and signed by the farmer, the traditional authorities, and the district agricultural officers (DAOs) and county agricultural coordinator (CAC).</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>Jul 2012 ---- Sep 2017</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 235,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd><a href="mailto:h.liversage@ifad.org">Harold Liversage</a>, IFAD</dd>
			<dd><a href="http://operations.ifad.org/web/ifad/operations/country/project/tags/liberia/1616/project_overview" target="_blank">Project weblink</a></dd>
		</dl>
		<div style="clear: left"></div>
	</li>

			<dd>Ministry of Agriculture and Forestry</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Laos</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The programme aims to ensure food security and income for 17,000 rural poor households in 225 villages among nine districts in the Sayabouly and Oudomxay. Specifically by strengthening farmer's organisations to be able to promote the community-based natural resource management and through the adoption of the proposed technologies and improved access to water.<br />
<br />
With regard to land and natural resource governance, the programme intended to provide support for increasing ethic villagers' entitlements, for the management of communal lands and to help in implementing secure tenure rights for the communities to protect them against land grabbing.</dd>

		<h4>Southern Nyanza Community Development Project (SNCDP)</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_868'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_868'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_868'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>IFAD</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>IFAD</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Kenya</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The project intended to reduce poverty and improve the livelihoods of 100,000 households in six districts: Homa Bay, Kuria, Migori, Nyamira, Rachuonyo and Suba, that are among the poorest districts in the relatively high-potential agricultural area around Lake Victoria. The project’s intermediate objective was to enhance gendered empowerment of the rural communities through improved health and more rational use and management of natural resources for sustainable livelihood activities.<br />
<br />
On land and natural resource governance, the project intended to enable in particular the poor and vulnerable groups to analyse their land tenure security situations and to establish contact with the District Land Office, Land Control Boards and Tribunals, chiefs and elders; it assisted the communities in installing a water supply scheme or rehabilitating their own scheme to meet the national standard set for per capita supply of water. 56 Participatory Rural Appraisal (PRA) processes were undertaken and community action plans developed through active community participation.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>Aug 2004 ---- Sep 2013</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 755,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd><a href="mailto:h.liversage@ifad.org">Harold Liversage</a>, IFAD</dd>
			<dd><a href="http://operations.ifad.org/web/ifad/operations/country/project/tags/kenya/1243/project_overview" target="_blank">Project weblink</a></dd>

			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>Spruce is the first title insurance, escrow, and closing company that uses technology to enable fast, frictionless, and secure real estate transactions.<br />
<br />
This approach allows Spruce to offer its customers a fully digital experience providing a user-friendly way to access titling insurance and reach settlement quickly and easily. Spruce guarantees that borrowers receive lower overall costs, faster, more confident closing times, and protection of money and identity by utilizing encryption technology.<br />
<br />
Omidyar Network’s funding helps Spruce expand its technology offering, grow the team and accelerate growth.</dd>

	<li id="programme_854" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Stenthening National Geographic Services in Lao PDR</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_854'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_854'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_854'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>Finland</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>National Geographic Department</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Laos</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The programme purpose is to assist the National Geographic Department (NGD) in creating, managing and distributing reliable modern national spatial data services to public and private stakeholders and clients. The services include database for digital topographic maps at 1:50,000 and digital orthophoto maps based on fresh digital aerial photography which is part of the programme implementation. The programme also includes densification of the horizontal and vertical control point networks over entire country.<br />
<br />
SNGS project ended in August 2014. In general, the objectives of SNGS have been achieved rather well. Orthophoto coverage at the end of the SNGS will be twice the original project area, i.e. approx. 2/3 of the country. It has substantially increased technical and institutional capacity of the partner organizations (National Geographic Department, NGD, and surveying and Mapping Centre, SMC). High resolution digital orthopohoto (1:5,000) and topographic (1:50,000) maps are unique products in Lao PDR.<br />
<br />
The SNGS extension is planned to last from August 2014 until December 2015 and it serves as an implementation of exit strategy of SNGS project. The extension will focus especially on ensuring the institutional sustainability. The project purpose is to ensure that the NGD and the SMC have long term capability and financial means to produce and distribute good quality and up-to-date geospatial data.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>Jan 2010 ---- Jan 2015</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 7,605,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd><a href="mailto:eeva.lehtinen@formin.fi">Ms. Eeva Lehtinen</a>, Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland, +358(0)295 350 000</dd>
			<dd></dd>
		</dl>
		<div style="clear: left"></div>
	</li>

Land and natural resource governance related activities aim at guaranteeing equitable access to and sustainable management of forest land.</dd>

	<li id="programme_716" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Strengthening Artisanal Fishers' Resource Rights Project (PRODIPRA)</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_716'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_716'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_716'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>Belgium<br />IFAD</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>Institute for Development of Small-scale Fisheries (IDDPE)</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Mozambique</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>This grant, which complements the Artisanal Fisheries Promotion Project (ProPESCA)  aims to improve the livelihoods of artisanal fishing communities along the whole coastline of Mozambique by strengthening their land tenure security and the management of natural resources. This will be achieved through the promotion of activities and approaches for securing land and natural resource rights, the promotion of awareness, advocacy and policy dialogue on land and natural resource tenure issues by, and on behalf of, the target group, strengthening the capacity of partner institutions, and the promotion of lesson learning, knowledge management and dissemination of information on land and natural resource tenure security issues among stakeholders within Eastern and Southern Africa, other regions in Africa and globally.<br />
<br />
The activities include the recognition of community-based NRM structures, community land use planning and community land delimitation, forestry co-management and the recognition of community land and natural resource use management plans; the documentation and mapping of natural resource use and the registration of communities’ rights; the documentation of local natural resource management practices and conflict management and resolution.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>Dec 2013 ---- Dec 2016</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 845,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd><a href="mailto:h.liversage@ifad.org">Harold Liversage</a>, IFAD</dd>
			<dd><a href="http://operations.ifad.org/web/ifad/operations/country/project/tags/mozambique/1517/project_overview" target="_blank">Project weblink</a></dd>
		</dl>
		<div style="clear: left"></div>
	</li>

	<li id="programme_991" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Strengthening Land Governance</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_991'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
