                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_991'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>Switzerland</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>CDE Bern, Land Core Group, Transnational Institute</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Burma</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The recent transition to market economy and<br />
creation of land market has led to increased land<br />
speculation. In the face of weak legal frameworks<br />
and institutions for their protection, the land access<br />
of women and men farmers, especially those<br />
(mostly ethnic minorities) living in upland shifting<br />
cultivation areas, is at risk. Land governance will<br />
be a central issue in any political dialogue with<br />
ethnic leaders. The rapidly evolving political<br />
environment presents both opportunities and risks<br />
for equitable land governance.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>Oct 2014 ---- May 2017</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 3,939,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>

	<li id="programme_1170" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Strengthening Land Governance System for Smallholder Farmers in Malawi</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1170'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>

                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1170'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>European Union</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>OXFAM GB</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Malawi</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The overall objective is to increase land tenure security for improved and sustainable agricultural production. The specific objective is to pilot, test and recommend for scale up an  gender sensitive land governance system in customary estates. <br />
The project is developed around three clusters of activities:  1) awareness raising for district and local level structures on land governance instruments and frameworks (development and testing of gender sensitive guidelines and procedures to be used in customary estates);2) development of a system to monitor the implementation of customary land governance frameworks (monitoring the application of the gender-sensitive guidelines); 3) development of explanatory, visibility and promotional materials on the land governance project.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>Sep 2015 ---- Sep 2019</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 3,340,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd><a href="mailto:Mutemwe.KAVALO@eeas.europa.eu">Mutemwe KAVALO</a>, EU Delegation to the Republic of Malawi</dd>
			<dd></dd>
		</dl>

	<li id="programme_608" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Strengthening management and consolidation of the Protected Areas System</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_608'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_608'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_608'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>Germany</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>GIZ</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Bolivia</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The project aims to strengthen and support the management of protected areas in the Municipio de La Paz. It is mainly advising the municipality on drafting and implementing management plans for the 27 protected areas. Furthermore, adaptation measures are being designed that consider the impact of glacial retreat and the associated reduction in the amount of water available to La Paz and neighbouring communities as well as the spread of agricultural activities into local forests. At the end of the project, all protected areas should have management plans that cover specific activities. These will include reforestation using native tree species, studies on aquatic animals and plants, environmental education programmes for civil society, the management of water catchment areas and environmental services. </dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>Mar 2011 ---- Feb 2014</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 660,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd><a href="mailto:programmbuero@programmbuero-klima.de">Programme Office of the International Climate Initiative</a>, IKI, +49 (0)30 338 424 - 218</dd>
			<dd><a href="http://www.international-climate-initiative.com/de/nc/projekte/weltkarte-und-projektliste/?tx_wiminnoprojektkarte_pi1[pro]=58&tx" target="_blank">Project weblink</a></dd>
		</dl>
		<div style="clear: left"></div>
	</li>

			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>RCN, Justice &amp; Démocratie</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Rwanda</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The aim of the programme is through the work of RCN Justice et Democratie to enable citizen participation in proximity justice; facilitate constructive dialogue and raise awareness about the rights and duties of the population, the law and the functioning of proximity justice; seek to safeguard the rights of vulnerable and marginalized groups in particular women’s access to justice and participation in decision making; promote the role of civil society and reinforce the capacity of CSOs to fulfil their mandate; provide support to  local authorities to enable them to discharge their duties, including capacity building, knowledge transfer, coaching and materials; conduct and disseminate original research and engage decision makers with evidence-based advocacy; and support exchanges at local and national level between proximity justice and civil society actors.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>

			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Colombia</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The outcomes of the project are: 1) Ethnic Communities victims of dispossession or forced abandon, in areas prioritized by the Land Restitution Unit (URT), have access to the land restitution process; 2) Families of settled peasant communities in prioritized areas affected by armed conflict, improve their sustainable livelihoods (social, environmental and economic conditions); and 3) Land Restitution Unit (URT) and public and private entities strengthen their intervention and coordination to offer an integral response to the rural population and its territories. Support of 49 000 000 SEK.</dd>

	<li id="programme_528" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Sudan Rural Land Governance Project</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_528'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_528'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_528'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>United States</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>Tetra Tech ARD</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>South Sudan</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The goal of the USAID Sudan Rural Land Governance project (SRLG Project) will be to define and establish rural land governance institutions and processes so as to promote property rights, encourage sound land use management, mitigate conflict, reduce the potential for  rural landowners to be divested of their land, and to encourage broad-based participation in future land allocation, management, and investment decisions. To achieve these objectives, the SRLG Project will: 1) Provide ongoing technical assistance at the National level to the south Sudan Land Commission to refine the Land Act 2009 and other related legislation as a result of the final policy outcomes; 2) Develop draft implementing regulations at the State-level to stipulate land governance processes and related institutions in rural areas; 3) Pilot these regulations through establishment and operationalization of at least two County Land Authorities (CLAs); 4) Build capacity of State and County level land authorities through site specific actions to secure land tenure and improve land use planning in each of the two counties, and; 5) Promote investment opportunities and mitigate conflict</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>Nov 2011 ---- Feb 2014</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 9,890,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd><a href="mailto:lolemi@usaid.gov">Lokosang Lemi</a>, USAID</dd>
			<dd><a href="https://land-links.org/project/sudan-rural-land-and-governance-project/" target="_blank">Project weblink</a></dd>
		</dl>
		<div style="clear: left"></div>
	</li>

                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>IFAD</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>Rural Development and Cooperatives Division (RDCD) of the Ministry of Local Government, Rural Development and Cooperatives</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Bangladesh</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The aim of the project was to increasing assets and income of 90.000 households in Sunamganj district by diversifying livelihood and employment opportunities. The objectives were to improve access to essential services and resources, including credit and to support the development of a viable national institution to replicate the project approach in other areas of Bangladesh.<br />
<br />
With regard to land and natural resource governance, the project intended to demarcate wetland and conservation areas, support reforestation measures and grant leases to 293 Beels (wetland) and other user groups.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>

	<li id="programme_680" class="programmedetails">

                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_680'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>

                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_680'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>FAO<br />Germany</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Liberia<br />Mongolia<br />Sierra Leone</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>This project is intended to form part of the overall support programme specifically envisaged to provide targeted support for the implementation of the Voluntary Guidelines on the Responsible Governance of Tenure of Land, Fisheries and Forests in the Context of National Food Security (Voluntary Guidelines) at country level over a period of 30 months. Relevant components under this proposal focus on i) building awareness and supporting the development of multi-stakeholder national forums in selected countries.<br />
<br />
Component 1, which focuses on Liberia, Mongolia and Sierra Leone will focus on delivering country level workshops for a total of USD 300.000 to raise awareness on the Voluntary Guidelines, increasing the ability of governments and citizens to understand and administer tenure rights and the processes involved in providing access to and transferring such rights, supporting multi-stakeholder national forums and the development of plans for mainstreaming the Voluntary Guidelines in participating countries.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>Feb 2014 ---- Aug 2016</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 300,000</dd>

			<dd></dd>

                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_681'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>FAO<br />Germany</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Sierra Leone</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>This project is intended to form part of the overall support programme specifically envisaged to provide targeted support for the implementation of the Voluntary Guidelines on the Responsible Governance of Tenure of Land, Fisheries and Forests in the Context of National Food Security (Voluntary Guidelines) at country level over a period of 30 months. Relevant components under this proposal focus on i) building awareness and supporting the development of multi-stakeholder national forums in selected countries; and iii) supporting the implementation of the Voluntary Guidelines in Sierra Leone through a multi-sectoral intervention.<br />
<br />
Component 3 will focus on providing technical support to Sierra Leone in the following five thematic areas: Legal Framework Assessment, Land Administration and Enabling Technologies, Fisheries Tenure, Forestry Tenure and Right to Food.</dd>
		</dl>

	<li id="programme_703" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Support for Country Level Implementation of the Voluntary Guidelines, Component 1</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_703'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_703'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_703'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>FAO<br />Switzerland</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Niger<br />Senegal</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>Italy is providing financial support over three years for the dissemination and effective and high quality implementation of the Voluntary Guidelines on the Responsible Governance of Tenure of Land, Fisheries and Forests in the Context of National Food Security (Voluntary Guidelines). <br />
Component 1 of the project focuses on providing a series of 3 country level workshops in each participating country (Senegal and Niger).<br />
The overall objective of the national workshops will be to increase the ability of governments and citizens to understand and administer tenure rights and the processes involved in providing access to and transferring such rights by developing a critical mass of informed stakeholders. <br />
The aim of the workshop series (three per country) is to promote the following: a) assist participants to contribute to the improvement and development of the national policy, legal and organizational frameworks regulating the range of tenure rights and to develop concrete plans for implementing the VGGT in their countries; b) create informed communities that are able to contribute to the reform process and monitor progress over time; and c) create learning cadres that will receive further training through e-learning and blended learning planned for the future.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>Jan 2014 ---- Dec 2017</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 399,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd><a href="mailto:JeanMaurice.Durand@fao.org">Jean Maurice Durand</a>, FAO</dd>
			<dd><a href="http://www.fao.org/nr/tenure/en/" target="_blank">Project weblink</a></dd>
		</dl>
		<div style="clear: left"></div>
	</li>

		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">

			<dd>Madagascar</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>In 2005, following a participatory and consultative process, the Malagasy Government adopted a Letter of Land Policy setting the strategic directions of the Malagasy Land Policy, which revolves around four strategic axes: the restructuring, modernization and computerization of land services; improving the implementation of decentralized land management; updating the national and land regulations;the implementation of a national training plan for careers in land, new skills and communication.</dd>

	<li id="programme_976" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Support for the Formulation of Africa-wide, Pro-poor Land Policy Guidelines</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_976'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_976'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_976'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>IFAD</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>UN ECA</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>This large grant was given to the UN ECA to support the development of land policy framework and guidelines for Africa. With regard to this, it supports the regional assessments and consultations for the formulation, review and implementation of pro-poor land policies at national and regional level. The overarching goal was to ensure security of land rights, increased productivity, secured livelihoods and broad-based economic growth and sustainable development in Africa. The target group consisted of the key stakeholders at regional and national levels, particularly all Member States of the African Union (AU), representatives of the Regional Economic Commissions and representatives of civil society, including representatives of the rural poor and small-scale farmers. The ultimate beneficiaries were persons in the AU’s member states and above all, the rural poor who will benefit from pro-poor land policies that address their concerns and mitigate their problems concerning land issues.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>Apr 2009 ---- Jun 2011</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 2,300,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd><a href="mailto:h.liversage@ifad.org">Harold Liversage</a>, IFAD</dd>
			<dd></dd>
		</dl>
		<div style="clear: left"></div>
	</li>

	<li id="programme_686" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Support for the Implementation of the Voluntary Guidelines on Land Tenure (Component 1)</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_686'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_686'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_686'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>FAO<br />United Kingdom</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Burma<br />Nepal<br />South Africa</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The United Kingdom will provide financial support totalling GBP 3 922 159 over three years for the dissemination and effective and high quality implementation of the Voluntary Guidelines on the Responsible Governance of Tenure of Land, Fisheries and Forests in the Context of National Food Security (Voluntary Guidelines) which were globally endorsed by the Committee on World Food Security in May 2012 and whose implementation has been encouraged by the UK. Effective implementation of the Voluntary Guidelines is also the overarching purpose of the new G8 land partnerships negotiated in 2013 under the UK G8 Presidency. <br />
Component 1, which focuses on Myanmar, Nepal, and South Africa will focus on delivering country level workshops to raise awareness on the Voluntary Guidelines, increasing the ability of governments and citizens to understand and administer tenure rights and the processes involved in providing access to and transferring such rights, supporting multi-stakeholder national forums and the development of plans for mainstreaming the Voluntary Guidelines in participating countries.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>Dec 2013 ---- Mar 2017</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 400,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd><a href="mailto:Andrew.Hilton@fao.org">Andrew Hilton</a>, FAO, +39 0657054987</dd>
			<dd><a href="http://www.fao.org/nr/tenure/en/" target="_blank">Project weblink</a></dd>
		</dl>
		<div style="clear: left"></div>
	</li>


	<li id="programme_687" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Support for the Implementation of the Voluntary Guidelines on Land Tenure (Component 2)</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_687'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_687'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_687'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>FAO<br />United Kingdom</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Nigeria</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The United Kingdom will provide financial support totalling the amount of GBP 3 922 159 over three years for the dissemination and effective and high quality implementation of the Voluntary Guidelines on the Responsible Governance of Tenure of Land, Fisheries and Forests in the Context of National Food Security. <br />
Component 2.3 (1.444 USD) includes piloting of the Open Tenure Crowd Sourcing setup (mobile phone and cloud server host) in Nigeria. FAO has worked with community groups in a number of Nigerian states, including Kaduna, on forestry and agriculture. Kaduna has the added advantage of being one of three states where the FAO’s open source land administration (SOLA) software has been implemented in support of systematic land titling and registration (SLTR) pilots undertaken through the DFID-funded GEMS3 project. Another three to five states are expected to implement SLTR pilots using SOLA by early 2014. The proposed Open Tenure Crowd Sourcing software will be highly relevant to the SLTR work and especially for scaling-up activities when GEMS3 ends. Community based activities to strengthen their tenure rights using Open Tenure Crowd Sourcing tools that have common components and similar processes such as used in SLTR will be more easily aligned. They will facilitate the transition of community recorded tenure rights to more formal mechanisms, thus improving the security of those rights and access to credit.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>Dec 2013 ---- Mar 2017</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 988,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd><a href="mailto:Mackay.Rigava@fao.org">Mackay Rigava</a>, FAO</dd>
			<dd><a href="http://www.fao.org/nr/tenure/en/" target="_blank">Project weblink</a></dd>
		</dl>
		<div style="clear: left"></div>
	</li>


	<li id="programme_688" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Support for the Implementation of the Voluntary Guidelines on Land Tenure (Component 3, China, India and South Africa)</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_688'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_688'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_688'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>FAO<br />United Kingdom</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>China<br />India<br />South Africa</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The project comprises workshops and activities to increase the awareness of Chinese, Indian and South-African investors involved in extraterritorial (i.e. overseas or outbound) investments. The scope of the study draws upon wider international experience of several BRICS countries.<br />
<br />
In China, the original target country for this activity, it has proven to be particularly difficult to identify and contact suitable institutions. Efforts to find an appropriate institution will continue, with the help of colleagues in the Trade and Markets Division.<br />
<br />
In September 2015, the study started in India under a consultancy agreement with Professor Praveen Kumar Jha of the Jawaharlal Nehru University, New Delhi, India. A first draft was delivered in late December 2015 that is currently under review. The study focusses on the extraterritorial investments of India in African countries (e.g., in Ethiopia, Mali, Mozambique, Tanzania and Uganda).<br />
<br />
A contract under Letter of Agreement is also underway with the NEPAD Business Foundation in South Africa. The NEPAD Business Foundation provided a detailed work plan for the study. It is expected that they will start the study in 2016. They will also concentrate on investments in African countries.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>Dec 2013 ---- Mar 2017</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 388,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd><a href="mailto:Louisa.Jansen@fao.org">Louisa Jansen</a>, FAO</dd>
			<dd><a href="http://www.fao.org/nr/tenure/en/" target="_blank">Project weblink</a></dd>
		</dl>

	<li id="programme_704" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Support for the Implementation of the Voluntary Guidelines on Land Tenure (Component 3, Nigeria and Uganda)</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_704'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_704'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_704'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>FAO<br />United Kingdom</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Nigeria<br />Uganda</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The United Kingdom is providing financial support totalling GBP 3 922 159 over three years for the dissemination and effective and high quality implementation of the Voluntary Guidelines on the Responsible Governance of Tenure of Land, Fisheries and Forests in the Context of National Food Security (Voluntary Guidelines) which were globally endorsed by the Committee on World Food Security in May 2012 and whose implementation has been encouraged by the UK. <br />
Component 3.1 of the project includes funding for country level activities in Uganda and Nigeria. Both countries have undergone a participatory land governance assessment. <br />
The in-depth work will build on the insights of these assessments and on the dynamics generated through the awareness raising workshops and related process that the FAO will start with. <br />
Technical assistance will be provided to address specific issues raised as priorities. In Uganda, these include a review of the land use policy to address challenges caused by pressure on land in the agricultural sector; targeted studies into tenure issues relating to the rural poor; institutional capacity development and training; development of innovative approaches for recording informal, customary, and user rights. <br />
In Nigeria work will focus on issues raised in the LGAF, the workshops and the subsequently provided technical assistance will be linked to the work undertaken by the G8 Land Partnership, namely for improving transparency in the land sector, securing tenure for the population and strengthening capacities of key stakeholders. The programme will also carry out a study into the regulatory provisions and guideline requirements to establish and manage grazing reserves and stock routes.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>Dec 2013 ---- Mar 2017</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 879,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd><a href="mailto:Louisa.Jansen@fao.org">Louisa Jansen</a>, FAO</dd>
			<dd><a href="http://www.fao.org/nr/tenure/en/" target="_blank">Project weblink</a></dd>
		</dl>
		<div style="clear: left"></div>
	</li>

		<dl class="pdetails2">

	<li id="programme_1018" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Support in the development of a pasture land law and forest tenure assessment (Mongolia)</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1018'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1018'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1018'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>FAO</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>FAO</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Mongolia</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>FAO with funding of a sister project conducted two multi-stakeholder workshops in Mongolia, in October 2014 and November 2015. The workshops re-launched dialogue on tenure in the country, raised awareness on the VGGT and served to develop an action plan and assess progress made in the implementation of the VGGT. As a result, a National Multi-stakeholder Platform (advisory role) and a Working Group (coordination and conduct of activities) were established in support of national VGGT implementation. The groups serve as a foundation for collectively addressing a broad range of activities to implement the VGGT and are coordinated by the Ministry of Food and Agriculture and the People Centered Conservation in Mongolia (PCC), a local NGO. The VGGT Working Group was formalized through an Order of the State Secretary of the Ministry of Food and Agriculture, which collectively reviewed the translation of the VGGT and officially presented it during the second workshop in November 2015. <br />
Resulting from the momentum created through these activities, and the priority areas for action identified during the first workshop, the Government of Mongolia requested FAO technical support in work related to the drafting of a pasture land law and a forest tenure assessment. Project funding offered the opportunity to respond to both requests.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>Oct 2014 ---- Jul 2016</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 170,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd><a href="mailto:JeanMaurice.Durand@fao.org">Jean Maurice Durand</a>, FAO</dd>
			<dd><a href="http://www.fao.org/nr/tenure/en/" target="_blank">Project weblink</a></dd>
		</dl>
		<div style="clear: left"></div>
	</li>

	<li id="programme_328" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Support program for zonal development - Niger Office</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">

	<li id="programme_901" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Support Programme for Rural Microenterprise Poles and Regional Economies (PROSPERER)</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_901'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_901'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_901'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>IFAD</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>Ministry of Agriculture, Federation of Chambers of Commerce and Industry</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Madagascar</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The programme aims to increase the incomes of poor rural people among 51,000 households in five of the country's poorest and most densely populated regions: Sofia, Analamanga, Itasy, Vatovavy Fitovinany, Haute Matsiatra. It aims to promote increased revenues by consolidating rural micro enterprises at local and regional levels and  improve their competitiveness; to contribute to the development of an institutional framework and national policy support to rural microenterprises; and to create a structured environment fostering the modernization of rural industries.<br />
<br />
Land and natural resource governance related activities include the opening of 22 land offices to obtain land ownership certificates and the establishment of 19 Single Windows Multi-Services / Ivo Fanoitra (GUMS / IF) at the district level, which will be led by two management consultants. These unique windows are also a key operational tool to make contact with professional organizations and federations, identify support service providers to SEA and supervise the services provided.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>Apr 2008 ---- Dec 2016</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 575,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd><a href="mailto:h.liversage@ifad.org">Harold Liversage</a>, IFAD</dd>
			<dd><a href="http://operations.ifad.org/web/ifad/operations/country/project/tags/madagascar/1401/project_overview" target="_blank">Project weblink</a></dd>
		</dl>
		<div style="clear: left"></div>
	</li>

	<li id="programme_906" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Support Project for the Strategic Plan for the Transformation of Agriculture (PAPSTA)</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_906'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_906'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_906'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>Belgium<br />Germany<br />United Kingdom<br />IFAD</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>Ministry of Agriculture and Animal Resources</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Rwanda</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The goal of the project was to contribute to the poverty reduction process by providing implementation support to the Strategic Plan for the Transformation of Agriculture (PSTA) which aims to effect a gradual shift from prevailing subsistence agriculture to market-based farming. The project helped the government address the main development constraints and challenges identified within the PSTA. It aimed to strengthen the capacity of key stakeholders to implement agricultural development plans in potential growth areas within the PSTA framework. The project aimed to benefit 10,000 households, giving priority  to households headed by women, as well as young people, landless people, orphans and families affected by HIV/AIDS and civil war, in the districts of Budaha, Bukonya, Karaba, Ngenda, Nyamure and Rusumo.  It intended to undertake actions to overcome the main constraints related to soil fertility and watershed protection, livestock improvement, increasing rice production and intensifying research and extension. <br />
<br />
With regard to land and natural resource governance, the project intended to provide support for a sustainable and productive water and land management system, it used watershed management plans and linked them to value chain plans undertaking participatory planning exercises addressing land tenure issues.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>Mar 2006 ---- Mar 2013</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 3,805,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd><a href="mailto:h.liversage@ifad.org">Harold Liversage</a>, IFAD</dd>
			<dd><a href="http://operations.ifad.org/web/ifad/operations/country/project/tags/rwanda/1320/project_overview" target="_blank">Project weblink</a></dd>
		</dl>

	</li>

	<li id="programme_701" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Support the implementation of the Voluntary Guidelines on Responsible Governance of Tenure</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_701'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_701'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_701'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>FAO<br />France</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Niger<br />Senegal</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The project aims to increase stakeholders knowledge on the Voluntary Guidelines on the Responsible Governance of Tenure of Land, Fisheries and Forests in the Context of National Food Security (Voluntary Guidelines) and promote the development, implementation and monitoring of policies, laws and practices that improve the governance of tenure. Responsible governance of tenure influence the way in which people, communities and others gain access to land, fisheries and forests. The livelihoods of people are based on secure and equitable access to and control over these resources. The project aims to promote responsible practices that will improve food security and the sustainable management of natural resources. <br />
<br />
Two workshops have been organized - one in Niger (28-30 January 2014) and one in Senegal (12-14 March 2014). These workshops have been the occasion to raise awareness on the VGGT and to participatorily realize a first assessment of the governance of tenure in the country (tacking stock study of the 20 years of existence of the Code Rural in Niger and results of the LGAF in Senegal). The workshops have been a unique occasion to gather land governance stakeholders who rarely met. Presentations on initiatives by civil society, farmers’organizations and governments enabled synergies to be found.<br />
In addition, the workshops have helped to launch partnerships (Code Rural in Niger and IPAR in Senegal) necessary to drive the process of dialogue that will be continued with the three up-coming workshops in each country under Italian funds.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>Jan 2014 ---- Dec 2017</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 135,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd><a href="mailto:JeanMaurice.Durand@fao.org">Jean Maurice Durand</a>, FAO</dd>
			<dd><a href="http://www.fao.org/nr/tenure/en/" target="_blank">Project weblink</a></dd>
		</dl>
		<div style="clear: left"></div>
	</li>


	<li id="programme_1022" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Support the implementation of the Voluntary Guidelines on Responsible Governance of Tenure</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1022'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1022'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1022'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>FAO</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Central African Republic</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>A national workshop on harmonizing legal instruments of tenure took place in Bangui in July 2015, where 75 participants discussed the value and use of the Voluntary Guidelines in Central African Republic and identified legal actions to improve governance of tenure. The participants included representatives from academia, civil society, indigenous peoples and the private sector. A comprehensive legal review served as a base to establish principles for future legal reforms and from which to propose a framework law on tenure rights. Wide consultation with local communities and civil society was recommended as a next step towards the adoption of a framework law by government institutions. The workshop closing was chaired by the Prime Minister accompanied by seven ministers.<br />
The workshop was organized by the Ministry of Urban Development and Housing with the technical and financial support of FAO.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>Apr 2013 ---- Dec 2015</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 70,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd><a href="mailto:JeanMaurice.Durand@fao.org">Jean Maurice Durand</a>, FAO</dd>
			<dd><a href="http://www.fao.org/nr/tenure/en/" target="_blank">Project weblink</a></dd>
		</dl>
		<div style="clear: left"></div>
	</li>


	<li id="programme_1023" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Support the implementation of the Voluntary Guidelines on Responsible Governance of Tenure</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1023'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1023'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1023'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>

        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>FAO</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Gabon</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>A national workshop on the Voluntary Guidelines was held in Libreville during 14-16 January to help to strengthen the national dialogue on the most pressing tenure challenges and opportunities in Gabon and the use of the Voluntary Guidelines in light of ongoing reforms. The participants agreed to create a multi-sectoral committee to continue striving for improved governance of tenure and to formulate a cross-sectoral strategy for implementing the Voluntary Guidelines in Gabon at all levels. The workshop was co-organized by the Ministry of Agriculture, Livestock, Fisheries and Food Security, the General Secretariat of the Government of Gabon and FAO. It brought together 75 representatives from the national tenure administration, farmers' organizations, civil society, international organizations, the private sector, NGOs and academia.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>Oct 2014 ---- Jun 2016</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 70,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd><a href="mailto:JeanMaurice.Durand@fao.org">Jean Maurice Durand</a>, FAO</dd>
			<dd><a href="http://www.fao.org/nr/tenure/en/" target="_blank">Project weblink</a></dd>

	<li id="programme_1021" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Support the implementation of the Voluntary Guidelines on Responsible Governance of Tenure (Congo)</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1021'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>

                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1021'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>FAO</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Congo, Republic of the</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>Te Ministry of Land Affairs and Public Domain hosted a national workshop in Brazzaville during 5-7 October  2015 that brought together 64 people from various sectors to discuss the relevance of the Voluntary Guidelines. As forests cover about 70 percent of the country, the workshop was an opportunity to improve the understanding of linkages between tenure and forestry. The participants endorsed recommendations, including the establishment of a multi-stakeholder committee and the dissemination of the Voluntary Guidelines at decentralized levels. The actions proposed include integrating the Voluntary Guidelines in national processes by improving the normative framework, conducting reforms to improve tenure governance and launching a consultation process for the development of a national land use plan. The workshop was organized with the technical and financial support of FAO.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>Jun 2015 ---- Dec 2015</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 70,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd><a href="mailto:JeanMaurice.Durand@fao.org">Jean Maurice Durand</a>, FAO</dd>
			<dd><a href="http://www.fao.org/nr/tenure/en/" target="_blank">Project weblink</a></dd>
		</dl>
		<div style="clear: left"></div>
	</li>


	<li id="programme_1020" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Support the implementation of the Voluntary Guidelines on the Responsible Governance of Tenure in Malawi</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">

                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1020'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>FAO<br />Sweden</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>FAO</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Malawi</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>Sweden identified itself as a resource partner to support the implementation of the Voluntary Guidelines on the Responsible Governance of Tenure of Land, Fisheries and Forests in the Context of National Food Security (VGGT). In 2014, Sweden financed a technical workshop in Malawi, which took place during 14-16 July, 2014 in collaboration with the Ministry of Land, Housing and Urban Development, Malawi. The workshop brought together a wide range of participants from land, agriculture, fisheries and forestry sectors from governments, district administration officials, civil society organizations and the private sector. A multi-stakeholder national platform was created to support and track VGGT implementation in Malawi.</dd>

	<li id="programme_1010" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Support to Agricultural Production and Marketing Project - Western Extension (PROPACOM WNW)</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1010'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1010'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1010'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>IFAD</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Cote d'Ivoire</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The project will complements the ongoing PROPACOM project in the centre-north, north and northeast of the country. It aims to reduce poverty and stimulate economic growth in the regions of Bafing, Béré, Folon, Kabadougou, Tonpki and Worodougou. The project will focus on increasing agricultural productivity of rice, maize, cassava and the vegetable value chain. It will improve food security by increasing 30,000 smallholder farmers households' access to services, rural financial services, technologies and markets. The project targets particularly women and young people who are involved in food production, processing and marketing in an effort to improve their incomes and livelihoods. <br />
<br />
On land and natural resource governance, the project aims to conduct population awareness campaigns in the local language for land registration. Further it will fund the cost of the bundle (document to be filled for requesting registration) for owners of lowlands and it will establish a device for land ownership clarification to rehabilitate and develop 2,300 ha of lowland.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Active</strong></dt>
			<dd>Nov 2014 ---- Dec 2020</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 3,500,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd><a href="mailto:h.liversage@ifad.org">Harold Liversage</a>, IFAD</dd>
			<dd><a href="http://operations.ifad.org/web/ifad/operations/country/project/tags/cote_divoire/1590/project_overview" target="_blank">Project weblink</a></dd>
		</dl>
		<div style="clear: left"></div>

	<li id="programme_1011" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Support to and capitalization on the EU Land Governance Programme in Africa (Phase I)</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1011'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1011'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1011'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>European Union<br />FAO</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>FAO</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Angola<br />Burundi<br />Cote d'Ivoire<br />Ethiopia<br />Kenya<br />Malawi<br />Niger<br />Somalia<br />Swaziland</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>This programme funded by the European Union (EU) aims at enhancing the joint implementation of the VGGT (Voluntary Guidelines on the Responsible Governance of Tenure of Land , Fisheries and Forests in the Context of National Food Security) and the F&amp;G (Framework and Guidelines of the Land Policy Initiative (LPI)) at Pan African level and at supporting and consolidating the implementation of the EU Land governance in 10 African countries (Burundi, Côte d’Ivoire, Niger, Ethiopia, Kenya, Somalia, South Sudan*, Angola, Malawi, Eswatini). The systematization of the knowledge sharing and aggregation of the lessons learnt amongst the 10 In–country projects will feed the support for integrated implementation at pan African level. On the other hand the Pan-African level component will focus on fostering political leadership on land governance, elaborating the monitoring and evaluation core system, preparing tailor made tools for joint implementation. The project will be handled by two FAO officers (P5&amp; P4) based in the LPI’s premises in Addis Ababa to ensure an optimal synergy for the integrated implementation. the programme aims at enhancing the land governance in Africa.<br />
South Sudan* project formally cancelled by EUD as per email, due to force majeure, on December 2016, operationally closed in July 2017.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>May 2014 ---- Sep 2019</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 2,400,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd><a href="mailto:MariaPaola.Rizzo@fao.org">Maria Paola Rizzo</a>, FAO</dd>
			<dd><a href="http://www.fao.org/tenure/en/" target="_blank">Project weblink</a></dd>
		</dl>

                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1107'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>

			<dd>European Union<br />FAO</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>FAO</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Brazil<br />Cameroon<br />Colombia<br />Ghana<br />Guinea-Bissau<br />Pakistan<br />Sudan<br />Uganda</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>This project complements the  project 'Support to and Capitalization on the EU Land Governance Programme in Africa' and is aimed at facilitating the integration of eigtht new in-country projects (Brazil, Cameroon, Columbia, Ghana, Guinea Bissau, Pakistan, Sudan and Uganda) into the existing mechanisms for transversal support under Phase I and enhances support by building on lessons learnt and additional needs particularly in the area of capacity development. All activities under Phase II will be interlinked, jointly implemented and mutually supportive of each other and of activities planned under Phase I. The following areas of work are addressed under this phase: (i) VGGT are mainstreamed in project during the project start-up phase; (ii) Activities of the in-country projects are capitalized and coordinated; (iii) Capacities of project staff, national counterparts and other stakeholders are developed; (iv) In-country projects receive direct support from FAO; (v) Monitoring is enhanced and lessons learnt are documented and disseminated.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">

Target communities in Kratie and Stung Treng provinces shall have secure access to their natural resources and biodiversity through secured community forest (CF) and community fishery (CFi) agreements and sustainable CF and CFi practices.</dd>

	<li id="programme_114" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Support to Development of Complementary Functions to the Belarusian Real Property Administrative System</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>

	<li id="programme_1159" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Support to Implementation of the Voluntary Guidelines on the Responsible Governance of Tenure of Land, Fisheries and Forests (Addendum)</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1159'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1159'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1159'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>FAO<br />Switzerland</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>FAO, African Land Policy Centre (ALPC)</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The Addendum to the project &quot;Supporting Implementation of the Voluntary Guidelines on the Responsible Governance of Tenure of Land, Fisheries and  Forests&quot; is aimed at (i) facilitating mainstreaming of VGGT and sharing of lessons across multiple countries and regions at Pan-African level and within the Sahel region. The expected output of the intervention includes integrated ALPC-FAO approach to land policy change at continental level, coordinated contextualization of FAO capacity development materials and learning programmes and a strategy for institutionalized integrated implementation of VGGT and F&amp;G; (ii) improving governance of tenure in pastoralism in selected countries in West Africa  within the Sahel region. This intervention is expected to result in improved governance of tenure in pastoralist communities through support to ECOWAS, awareness raising, contextualization of capacity development of ECOWAS and CSOs, compilation of best practices on mitigation, prevention and managing pastoralist conflicts and piloting the FAO Technical Guide on Governance of Pastoral Lands.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Active</strong></dt>
			<dd>Oct 2016 ---- Jun 2020</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 550,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd><a href="mailto:Mackay.Rigava@fao.org">Mackay Rigava</a>, FAO</dd>
			<dd></dd>
		</dl>
		<div style="clear: left"></div>
	</li>

	<li id="programme_1301" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Support to privatization of State agricultural land</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1301'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1301'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1301'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>FAO</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>FAO</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Macedonia</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The project is analyzing the current legal and institutional framework related to sale and management of state owned agricultural land, including for compliance with the Voluntary Guidelines on the Responsible Governance of Tenure of Land Fisheries and Forests in the Context of National Food Security (VGGT), and is providing policy recommendations for the use of management and sale of state land to improve farm structures and ensure access of smallholders to additional land. <br />
Upon the request of the Senior Management of the Ministry of Agriculture, Forestry and Water Economy (MAFWE), a note on the establishment of a new Land Agency was prepared. The proposal is based on a brief analysis of the Macedonian country context in the area of land management and European good practices. The background for the proposal is a wish to ensure a stronger coordination between the different land management instruments and create synergies including land consolidation, to catalyze the process.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>Jun 2018 ---- Jun 2019</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 72,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd><a href="mailto:Morten.Hartvigsen@fao.org">Morten Hartvigsen</a>, FAO</dd>
			<dd><a href="http://www.fao.org/tenure" target="_blank">Project weblink</a></dd>
		</dl>
		<div style="clear: left"></div>
	</li>

			<dd>Senegal</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>Améliorer la gouvernance foncière.Les types d'activités prévus incluent un inventaire du cadre législatif et réglementaire, l'élaboration d'un code foncier et domanial, la révision du cadre juridique pour  la transmission et l'échange sécurisé des actes authentiques en format électronique, l' établissement et la conservation des actes notariés en format électronique,l' élaboration de nouveaux modes d’enquêtes cadastrales - la conception de la base de donnés d’un Livre foncier informatisé, Inventaire des biens de l'Etat - Appui à la mise en place d’interface entre le bloc foncier et le bloc fiscal.</dd>

-	Food and Agriculture Organisation</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Kenya</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The program aims at strengthening food security of smallholder farmers and pastoralists' communities with improved access to agriculture services and to land. The program has two components (i) institutional support to the agriculture sector including county capacity building to pursue county and cross-county coordination and service delivery, support to intergovernmental coordination and to the transformation process within Ministry of Agriculture, Livestock and Fisheries. The second objective aims at improving the equitable access &amp; management of land for better livelihoods and socioeconomic development as per the VGGT.</dd>

			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>Netherlands</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>Global Land Tool Network (GLTN)</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>Support to the five year Strategic Plan of the Global Land Tool Network (GLTN) with the aim to support capacity of GLTN partners to help carry out land specific 'roadmaps' to stimulate land governance as described in the CFS Voluntary Guidelines; to encourage that Dutch GLTN partners are involved in the development of modern and low-cost instruments for better land governance; to underline the importance of the CFS Voluntary Guidelines and its adoption through a multi-stakeholder network like GLTN.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>Jun 2013 ---- Jun 2018</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 22,000,000</dd>

			<dd></dd>
