	<li id="programme_863" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Value Chain Development Programme (PRODEFI)</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_863'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_863'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_863'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>European Union<br />IFAD</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>Ministry of Agriculture and Livestock</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Burundi</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The programme aims to support public and private institutions, civil society and rural poor organizations to establish a good partnership in the development of two key agricultural sectors (rice and milk) and six secondary branches; it intends to build the human, physical and technical capacity of poor smallholder farmers to enable them to protect their productive assets, increase their production of rice and milk and raise their incomes. Approximately 77,500 households in the provinces of Cibitoke, Kayanza, Karusi, Bubanza, Muramvya, Gitega will benefit from the programme.<br />
<br />
With regard to land and natural resource governance, the programme aims to establish the legal status and land rights in each plot (hills and marshes) and to support the registration of newly entered in the community by strengthening the capacity of communal development centres (CDCs) and administrative authorities, agents of communal land services, local elected officials, and &quot;bashingantahe&quot; (council of elders). Land activities include measures that allow women to access their own plot of land. Landless women can also rent a plot of rehabilitated land.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>May 2010 ---- Jun 2019</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 9,300,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd><a href="mailto:h.liversage@ifad.org">Harold Liversage</a>, IFAD</dd>
			<dd><a href="http://operations.ifad.org/web/ifad/operations/country/project/tags/burundi/1489/project_overview" target="_blank">Project weblink</a></dd>
		</dl>
		<div style="clear: left"></div>
	</li>


	<li id="programme_767" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Vegetable Oil Development Project - Phase 2 (VODP 2)</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_767'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_767'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_767'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>Netherlands<br />IFAD</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>Ministry of Agriculture, Animal Industry and Fisheries</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Uganda</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>This project aims at increasing the domestic production of vegetable oil and its by-products, thus raising rural incomes for smallholder producers and ensuring the supply of affordable vegetable oil products to Ugandan consumers. To that end, the project is helping farmers to increase their production of crushing material (both oil palm and oilseeds) and establish commercial relations to link them directly to processors. The project will benefit 139,000 households covering 43 districts in four hubs: Lira, Eastern Uganda, Gulu and West Nile.<br />
<br />
Land and natural resource governance related interventions include the development of Environment and Resource Management Plans. Women are engaged in the project in their own right as landowners or tenants, as wives of landowners or tenants, or as plantation workers.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>Oct 2010 ---- Dec 2018</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 11,900,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>

	<li id="programme_1121" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>VGGT based forest tenure and CBF assessments - Congo Brazzaville, Gabon, Honduras, Mongolia, Portugal, Senegal, Zambia</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1121'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1121'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1121'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>FAO</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>FAO</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Congo, Republic of the<br />Gabon<br />Honduras<br />Mongolia<br />Senegal<br />Zambia</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>VGGT based forest tenure and CBF assessments conducted in each of the countries.  In Gabon and Congo Brazzaville the assessments will inform Ministry of Forests on status and challenges of CBF, and recommendations for improvement. In Honduras and Senegal, the assessments will be used to inform on-going forestry programs and design of new projects. In Mongolia, the assessment will be used to promote implementation of the VGGT and inform the pasture law being drafted. In Portugal, the findings are being used to promote policy dialogue on communal forest land tenure and management. In Zambia the assessments will inform the on-going FAO Technical Cooperation Program on Sustainable Forest and Woodland Management for Food and Nutrition Security in Western Province of Zambia.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>Mar 2017 ---- Apr 2018</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 55,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd><a href="mailto:David.Egiashvili@fao.org">David Egiashvili</a>, FAO, +39 0657052322</dd>
			<dd><a href="http://www.fao.org/tenure/en/" target="_blank">Project weblink</a></dd>
		</dl>
		<div style="clear: left"></div>
	</li>

			<dt>Summary:</dt>

			<dd>IFAD</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>Ministry of Agriculture</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Madagascar</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The aim of the programme is to contribute to an increase in the income of 110,000 smallholder households in 13 regions through professional and vocational training, leading to higher productivity and improved marketing of agricultural products. The programme specifically aims to support vulnerable groups, with special attention to uneducated youth and young women who are heads of household.<br />
<br />
Land and natural resource governance related activities include 6 land registration committees (CRIF) constituted by 10 land offices,  they include the support for the issuing of land certificates and plan to install at least 2000 ha of new irrigated areas and rehabilitate 4200 ha of existing or traditional boundaries in order to secure the control of water and/or expand the irrigated area.</dd>
		</dl>

		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>

	<li id="programme_636" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Western Caucasus World Natural Heritage Site – climate protection through sustainable forest management and decentralised exploitation of renewable energy sources in the newly created buffer zone</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_636'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_636'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_636'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>Germany</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>GIZ</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Russia</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>One of the negative impacts of uncontrolled deforestation within the Western Caucasus World Natural Heritage Site is that adjacent villages are being ever more frequently affected by flooding and landslides. The project combines protection and sustainable use of the remaining Nordmann fir forests through the designation of a buffer zone with sustainable forest management and exploitation of renewable energy sources. In addition to avoiding climate-changing emissions, this will guarantee a long-term income source for the population and reduce its exposure to impacts from climate change.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>Dec 2010 ---- Nov 2014</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 2,800,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd><a href="mailto:programmbuero@programmbuero-klima.de">Programme Office of the International Climate Initiative</a>, IKI, +49 (0)30 338 424 - 218</dd>
			<dd><a href="http://www.international-climate-initiative.com/de/nc/projekte/weltkarte-und-projektliste/?tx_wiminnoprojektkarte_pi1[pro]=112&t" target="_blank">Project weblink</a></dd>
		</dl>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>IFAD</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>Federal Ministry of Agriculture and Forestry</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Sudan</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The programme aims to build up traditional rain-fed agriculture and improve economic conditions of 61,500 households in the three Kordofan states. The programme focuses on the importance of appropriate natural resource management and the access of poor households to productive services and fair terms of trade.<br />
<br />
On land and natural resource governance, the programme intends to develop a harmonised natural resources legislation passed and implemented for farmland, grazing land, forest land and water, addressing clear access and use rights and appeal and arbitration mechanisms. The programme further supports the mapping and demarcation of traditional stock routes, participatory GIS mapping and the foundation of Conflict Resolution Centres along stock routes.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>Dec 2005 ---- Dec 2016</dd>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>IFAD</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>Ministry of Local Development</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Nepal</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The aim of the project is to ensure more resilient livelihoods and to defend the basic human dignity of poor and socially disadvantaged people in the western uplands of Nepal, by strengthening the capacity of 115,000 households to mobilise their own resources thus gaining access to external resources and ensuring social justice.<br />
<br />
Land and natural resource governance activities promote the transfer of lands, on a leasehold basis, to women and landless peoples to enable them to undertake leasehold forestry, increase their production of fodder crops and undertake NTFP (Non-timber Forest Product) production. The project supports the provision of services to organise new leasehold forest user groups and initial training, exposure visits, monitoring workshops, work schedule planning and operational planning reviews.</dd>
		</dl>

	<li id="programme_1171" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>Women’s Land Rights for Inclusive Development and Growth in Africa</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1171'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1171'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1171'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>European Union</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>STICHTING OXFAM NOVIB (NOVIB)</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Cameroon<br />Ethiopia<br />Kenya<br />Mozambique<br />Malawi<br />Togo<br />Tunisia<br />South Africa</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The overall objective is to ensure women’s access to and<br />
control over their land resources across Africa - supporting and enabling rural women’s voices. The action aims to effective independent and participatory monitoring by civil society of government progress on achieving targets related to the promotion of women’s land rights.<br />
In order to contribute to this goal, the action has three specific objectives:<br />
1) Monitor actions taken by governments in key countries and Regional Economic Communities (RECs), and hold them accountable to implement relevant AU Women's Land Rights (WLR) instruments; <br />
2) Empower rural women’s organizations to analyse, document and disseminate evidence on pronounced cases of missing WLR and action against the discriminatory land tenure systems and threats originating from large-scale land-based investments (LSLBIs); <br />
3) Promote recognition of Pan-African civil society for its leadership, knowledge and effective advocacy capacity on women’s land rights.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Active</strong></dt>
			<dd>Feb 2017 ---- Feb 2020</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 2,700,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd><a href="mailto:Antonio.MARTINEZ-PIQUERAS@ec.europa.eu">Antonio.MARTINEZ-PIQUERAS</a>, EU Commission, DEVCO E3, Development Coordination East and Southern Africa</dd>
			<dd></dd>
		</dl>

	<li id="programme_1303" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>“ENPARD Technical Assistance to the Ministry of Agriculture of the Republic of Armenia”</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1303'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1303'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1303'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>European Union<br />FAO</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>FAO</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Armenia</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>During 2017, FAO has under the FAO ENPARD project (GCP/ARM/006/EC) assessed the reasons for land abandonment, an emergent problem in Armenia, and prepared a Policy Note outlining a range of possible responses. The analysis revealed that land abandonment is a complex multi-dimensional process with interlinked economic, environmental, social factors causing it. The inability to irrigate (due to infrastructure constraints, economic constraints or for any other reasons) was found to be among the main drivers of land abandonment in Armenia. Thus, the multiple causality of land abandonment requires a coordinated policy response between agricultural policy, land policy and improvements in the irrigation sector. <br />
The policy note and the advise provided therein builds on the VGGT principles of good governance of tenure.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Completed</strong></dt>
			<dd>Dec 2014 ---- Nov 2018</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 2,200,000</dd>

	</li>


	<li id="programme_1302" class="programmedetails">
		<h4>“Mainstreaming of the National Land Consolidation Programme (MAINLAND)”</h4>
		<div class="social-media" style="text-align: right;">
                <ul>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://twitter.com/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1302'), 'twitter', 'width=575,height=400');return false;"><img src="assets/images/twitter.png" alt="Twitter icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1302'),'facebook-share-dialog','width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/facebook.png" alt="Facebook icon" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="#" onclick="window.open('https://www.linkedin.com/cws/share?url='+encodeURIComponent(location.protocol+'//'+location.host+'/#programme_1302'), 'linkedin', 'width=626,height=436');return false;"><img src="assets/images/linkedin.png" alt="Linkedin" /></a></li>
                        <li><a href="mailto:test@test.com"><img src="assets/images/email.png" alt="Email" /></a></li>
                </ul>
        </div>

		<dl class="pdetails1">
			<dt>Donors:</dt>
			<dd>European Union<br />FAO</dd>
			<dt>Implementers:</dt>
			<dd>FAO</dd>
			<dt>Partner countries:</dt>
			<dd>Macedonia</dd>
			<dt>Summary:</dt>
			<dd>The MAINLAND project is supporting the Ministry of Agriculture, Forestry and Water Economy (MAFWE) to build technical and administrative capacity to implement the National Land Consolidation Programme and the provisions of the National Land Consolidation Strategy adopted by the Government in 2012 for mainstreaming the National Land Consolidation Programme through (i) developing expertise and strengthening the land consolidation capacities of local stakeholders, (ii) raising public awareness about the benefits of land consolidation; and (iii) implementing the first round of land consolidation projects. <br />
The proposed approach to land consolidation is integrated, combining activities addressing small holding sizes and reducing land fragmentation with other local rural development needs, such as design and construction of new agricultural infrastructure, while preserving the environment. <br />
In supporting the land consolidation programme FAO respects a few key principles: respect all legitimate tenure rights (not just formally registered ownership rights); include safeguards – participatory process, fair valuation and accessible options for appeal; and the cornerstone principle that participants should be as well off after the project as before.</dd>
		</dl>
		<dl class="pdetails2">
			<dt><strong>Active</strong></dt>
			<dd>Mar 2017 ---- Aug 2020</dd>
                        <dt><strong>Programme value</strong></dt>
                        <dd>USD 2,653,000</dd>
			<dt></dt>
			<dd></dd>
			<dt><strong>Contact</strong></dt>
			<dd><a href="mailto:Morten.Hartvigsen@fao.org">Morten Hartvigsen</a>, FAO</dd>
			<dd><a href="http://www.fao.org/tenure" target="_blank">Project weblink</a></dd>
		</dl>

	</li>
